Title: Lead Engineer (AI Testing & Risk Controls)
Description:
What You‚Äôll Be Building
1. Accuracy Testing Harness
You will design and deliver a full evaluation environment that replaces slow, manual testing.
Core components:
Dataset ingestion: Load 10‚Äì20 expired bond/equity filings with ground truth values (coupon, maturity, conversions). Store them in a structured SQL or schema-driven format for repeated use.
Prompt runner: Run multiple prompt versions in parallel on the dataset. Automatically log all inputs and outputs.
Scoring engine: Compare outputs against ground truth. Generate metrics such as accuracy %, error categories, and nonsense detection (e.g., coupon = 75%).
Feedback loop: Track which prompts perform best, highlight recurring error patterns, and enable side-by-side comparisons.
Dashboard/interface: Provide a lightweight dashboard (Streamlit or equivalent) for analysts to filter by prompt version, document type, or error type.
Efficiency: Reduce refinement cycles from days to hours and enable quick experimentation.
2. Risk & Control Layer
A safety net to prevent risky or illogical outputs from reaching downstream systems.
Core components:
Rules engine: Hard-coded checks (e.g., coupon rates between 0‚Äì25%, deadlines not in the past). Extendable by Navvai/client analysts.
Validation logic: Cross-check related fields (e.g., record date before payment date). Ensure logical consistency.
Flagging system: Any outputs that break rules are flagged and logged with reasons.
Confidence scoring: Assign confidence levels (high, medium, low) to all extracted values. Low-confidence results are held back.
Audit & traceability: Log which page/section each value was extracted from. Enable full traceability for review and compliance.
Fail-safe mode: If an output fails critical checks, it is withheld automatically.
Skills: Database Testing, Bug Tracking & Reports, Component Testing, Stress Testing

Title: QA Tester for Instant Quote Calculator (Forms, UTMs, Integrations)
Description:
We need a detail-oriented QA pro to thoroughly test our instant quote calculator end-to-end‚Äîfrom first click to booked meeting‚Äîverifying data accuracy, tracking, and integrations.
Scope of Work
1) Functional & UX
Validate all inputs, required fields, error states, and conditional logic.
Confirm quote math/outputs are accurate across scenarios.
Check copy, labels, tooltips, mobile responsiveness, and accessibility basics (keyboard nav, labels).
2) Tracking & UTMs
Verify UTMs pass to Calendly confirmation page.
Validate events in GTM/GA4 (form start/complete), and that hidden fields are captured.
3) Integrations
Confirm data lands correctly in Calendly and other forms.
(If applicable) Confirm downstream notifications/emails and any webhooks fire with correct payloads.
4) Cross-Environment
Browsers: latest Chrome, Safari, Firefox, Edge.
Devices: desktop + iOS/Android (at least 1 iPhone, 1 Android).
Test Scenarios (minimum)
- Happy path with common inputs ‚Üí schedule meeting ‚Üí data passed to Pipedrive and Salesforce (we will confirm those two)
- Edge cases: min/max values, blanks, invalid formats, toggling answers, back/forward navigation.
- Slow network / refresh during form.
- Abandon and resume, then complete.
- Calendar booking from confirmation step.
Deliverables
- Bug/issue log (sheet) with: title, steps to reproduce, expected vs. actual, environment, screenshots/video, severity, suggested fix.
- Coverage checklist signed off (browsers/devices/scenarios).
- Short loom video (‚â§5 min) walking through critical issues and recommendations.
What We Provide
Staging/production links
Test credentials (if needed).
Expected calculator logic (pricing rules).
Must-Have Skills
Hands-on QA for forms/conversion funnels.
Experience testing CRM integrations Mobile + cross-browser QA. Basic accessibility checks.
Clear communication and meticulous documentation.
Nice to Have
Familiarity with involve.me (or similar form builders).
Basic JSON/webhook payload reading (DevTools ‚Üí Network).
Skills: Desktop Application Testing, Mobile App Testing, Annotated Screenshot

Description:

Title: QA Tester for AI Ad Automation Platform
Description:
Overview:
We‚Äôre developing Scalable, a web-based platform that uses AI to automate digital advertising workflows ‚Äî including competitor analysis, ad copy and image generation, campaign upload to Meta Ads, and campaign optimization.
We‚Äôre looking for an experienced QA tester to methodically review the front-end user experience, identify bugs, usability issues, and inconsistencies, and provide detailed feedback in a structured format.
What You‚Äôll Be Testing
1. User onboarding: account creation and Meta Ads Manager connection
2. Dashboard navigation: layout and responsiveness
3. AI modules: competitor analysis, copywriting, and image generation
4. Campaign workflow: ad creation, upload to Meta, and optimization dashboard
5. Account and settings pages: user details, project switching, and permissions
6. Cross-browser and mobile checks: Chrome, Safari, Edge, iOS, and Android browsers (multiple browser)
What You‚Äôll Deliver
Detailed bug log in a spreadsheet (Google Sheets or Notion) Including:
1. Page/Feature
2. Bug Type (UI / Functional / UX)
3. Severity (Low / Medium / High)
4. Steps to Reproduce
5. Expected vs Actual Result
6. Screenshot or Loom link
7. Browser/Device details
8. Clear notes on UX or onboarding friction points
Work Schedule & Scope
1. Initial QA: 2/3 full days of testing to cover the complete platform
2. Ongoing QA: 2 days of testing each month as new features are released
3. Deliverable deadline: End of each testing cycle (within 48 hours)
Requirements
1. Experience testing web SaaS products (ideally marketing or AI tools)
2. Access to a Meta Ads account (or sandbox/test setup)
3. Strong attention to detail and clear documentation habits
4. Ability to communicate findings via Google Sheets, Loom, or Slack

Title: QA Engineer (Windows) for Testing Native Rust Desktop Client
Description:
We are looking for an experienced QA engineer to test a native Windows desktop client written in Rust.
The client is part of our SVision Pro system ‚Äî a monitoring and analytics platform that collects activity data, manages sessions, and communicates with a backend server over REST API and WebSocket.
Your goal is to thoroughly test the Windows client for stability, performance, and reliability under different operating conditions.
Scope of Work
Install and run the Rust-based Windows client (provided as a .exe build).
Test the following areas:
App installation, startup, and shutdown stability
Authentication flow with backend (login/logout)
Real-time data sync over WebSocket and REST
Activity/session tracking and AFK detection
Screenshot capture and upload (if implemented)
Offline/online synchronization logic
System resource usage (CPU, RAM, disk, network)
Error recovery and reconnect behavior
Crash handling and logging functionality
Perform long-duration stability tests (multi-hour runs).
Check compatibility with Windows 10 and Windows 11.
Deliverables
Comprehensive test report with steps, results, and screenshots.
List of bugs grouped by severity (critical/major/minor).
Performance summary: average CPU, memory, and network usage over time.
Logs or crash dumps for reproducible issues.
Recommendations for stability and UX improvements.
Requirements
Proven experience testing Windows desktop applications (Rust, C++, C#, or similar).
Familiarity with REST APIs and WebSocket testing (Postman, Fiddler, Wireshark, etc.).
Strong manual QA skills; ability to record reproducible steps and capture system data.
Experience with performance or endurance testing.
Fluent English and clear reporting style.
Skills: Desktop Application Testing, Postman, Rust, C++, C

Title: Build End-to-End n8n Automation Flow for Therapist Video-to-Social Pipeline
Description:
Overview:
I‚Äôm looking for an automation specialist to build a hands-free AI content flow in n8n for a therapist client who records short educational videos. The goal is to transform each raw video into a polished social post (clip, caption, hashtags, and scheduled upload) ‚Äî without any manual steps between upload and publication.
This project will involve integrating video editing APIs, GPT-powered copy generation, and social publishing tools into one seamless pipeline.
‚∏ª
What I Need Built:
A fully automated n8n workflow that:
1.	Collects content
‚Ä¢	Therapist uploads a video and fills out a short form (topic, tone, audience, CTA).
‚Ä¢	Video + metadata auto-saves to Google Drive (or Dropbox) and logs in Airtable or Notion.
2.	Edits video automatically
‚Ä¢	Sends raw video to AI editing tool (Descript, OpusClip, or Munch API).
‚Ä¢	Adds captions, trims clips to optimal lengths, and returns link to edited file.
3.	Generates captions & hashtags
‚Ä¢	Uses OpenAI GPT-4 (or similar) to create Instagram-ready captions in a warm, grounded therapist tone.
‚Ä¢	Outputs both long and short versions plus 3‚Äì5 hashtags.
4.	Creates an approval loop
‚Ä¢	Sends therapist an email or Slack message with video preview and caption for review.

Title: QA Analyst / Test Lead
Description:
Teams and agencies are not being considered at this time.
We are seeking a reliable, detail-oriented QA Analyst / Test Lead to support NetSuite implementation and stabilization projects. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in fast-moving implementation environments, understands functional business workflows, and can independently manage testing from coverage review through retesting.
The ideal candidate will validate NetSuite functionality against business processes, identify test coverage gaps, execute test cases across multiple user roles, and manage issue tracking and resolution through completion. Clarity, consistency, and accountability are essential.
Responsibilities:
Review video walkthroughs and documentation outlining intended NetSuite functionality and ensure all workflows are covered in test cases.
Compare intended functionality to existing test cases and fill any gaps.
Execute functional and role-based test cases across key NetSuite modules such as Finance, Inventory, Manufacturing, Work Orders, WMS, and Fulfillment.
Document and track defects using structured reporting; retest once remediated.
Maintain and update the overall test plan, test execution log, and coverage matrix.
Validate that business processes flow correctly across roles, permissions, and transaction types (e.g., Sales Orders ‚Üí Work Orders ‚Üí Item Fulfillment ‚Üí Invoicing).
Communicate test progress, defects, and retest results clearly to project leadership.
Requirements:
Hands-on experience testing NetSuite ERP or equivalent enterprise systems.
Familiarity with role-based access, transaction lifecycles, and end-to-end process flows (e.g., order-to-cash, procure-to-pay, manufacturing).
Strong documentation, organization, and follow-through.
Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines without daily supervision.
Consistent communication and accountability. Must take ownership of testing quality from start to finish.
Please respond thoughtfully to the following questions (submissions without these answers will not be reviewed):
Describe your experience testing NetSuite or other ERP systems. What modules or workflows have you validated?
How do you structure and track your testing process (test plan, defect log, retesting)?
This role requires self-management and accountability. How do you stay organized and on track without daily oversight?
Skills: End-to-End Testing, Software QA, Functional Testing, Test Case Design

Title: Automation Engineer (Make.com & Zapier)

Build/maintain multi-step Make scenarios (routers, iterators/aggregators, data stores, custom modules, webhooks, error handlers).

English B2+ for meetings and documentation; reliable laptop, webcam/headset, stable internet (backup hotspot preferred).
Nice to have:
n8n/Pipedream/Workato; serverless (Lambda/Cloud Functions).
HubSpot/Salesforce APIs; queues/events; observability.

Title: Websites Performance and UX Evaluation (SOFTSWISS and Competitors): Djibouti
Description:
Objective:
Evaluate the performance and user experience of selected websites (SOFTSWISS projects and competitors) when accessed from Djibouti under real regional network conditions.
Goal:
To understand how websites perform across different connection types (3G, 4G, Wi-Fi), focusing on:
- Website loading time and smoothness;
- Correct display of UI elements (images, banners, text, animations);
- Responsiveness of key features such as registration, login, and deposit;
- Overall stability and accessibility of the website on local devices and networks.
Scope of Work:
For each website, record the following scenarios:
- First website load. - Registration form opening (all steps, with submitting the registration form).
- Deposit process. The minimum deposit is required.
- Game launch process.
- Login process.
- Casino opening process (Games page or Sportsbook).
Each test should be conducted under 3G, 4G, and Wi-Fi connections.
‚û°Ô∏è A total of 18 recordings per brand (6 scenarios √ó 3 connection types).
Device Type:
Preferably use a budget Android device (e.g., Tecno, Infinix, Xiaomi Redmi 9A) to better simulate typical local user conditions.
Data Privacy & Security:
To ensure compliance and data safety:
- Personal or financial data must not appear in the recordings.
- Blur or redact any personal information (names, emails, phone numbers, IDs, or card details).
- No credentials or identity data should be visible in the final materials.
üö´ Applicants outside Djibouti will not be considered.
üö´ No VPN / emulators.
Link to full instructions: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1C37njUog9ss0miXq53ltkZ2bf_FwYiE-/edit
Thank you! If anything is unclear during testing or your device/network setup differs from the requirements, please reach out before proceeding.
A short sample test video must be shared first for approval before recording the full set.
Skills: Functional Testing, Usability Testing, Bug Tracking & Reports, Web Testing, Software Testing, Bug Reports

Title: Device Testing Engineer (Mobile/Wireless), Philadelphia (USA)
Description:
Job Title: Device Testing Engineer (Mobile/Wireless)
Core Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Develop, document, and revise test plans and procedures and quality standards for software and hardware, focused on wireless products and related accessories
‚Ä¢ Manage the cross functional bug reporting and resolution process, ability to SW upgrade the devices using OEM tools.
‚Ä¢ Manage the test sample requirements and inventory. Ensure the distributed samples are tracked and upgraded to the latest available firmware level
‚Ä¢ Validate OEM and test partners test results by executing the regression test plan and perform other adhoc random testing
‚Ä¢ Test and certify MRs (maintenance releases or software updates) and Security MRs by executing the regression plan and the test cases impacted by the MR scope.
‚Ä¢ Manage activation and deactivation of the test samples
‚Ä¢ Compile test results data, collect logs and write required engineering reports, to report to OEMs and other fix agents.
‚Ä¢ Update issues tracking and management tools to ensure all the information is current and properly shared.
‚Ä¢ Troubleshoot related issues and test, maintain, and monitor relevant solutions and logs, Field testing if required to reproduce the issue.
‚Ä¢ Monitor customer-reported issues, perform root cause analysis, and develop test methods to improve overall customer satisfaction.
‚Ä¢ Deploy new test tools as required.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge in JIRA and Confluence.
‚Ä¢ Understanding of LTE and 5G RF and Core technologies.
‚Ä¢ Must be able to communicate effectively and convincingly with all areas of the company ‚Äì technical and non-technical - as well as with external parties.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with project stakeholders and internal Development and E2E teams.
‚Ä¢ Self-Starter and must be able to work independently with minimal supervision.
Education and Experience
Education Level - Bachelor's Degree or Equivalent
Field of Study ‚Äì Computer Science, Electronics and Telecommunications, Engineering or other related fields.
Certifications ‚Äì n/a
Years Experience ‚Äì 5+ years in product development and/or technology management roles, including 3+ years in mobile and/or wireless space
Other Specific skills:
‚Ä¢ Strong problem solving and analytical skills, communication (verbal and written) skills, leadership skills, and organizational/documentation skills.
‚Ä¢ Excellent project management skills, with a proven track record of successful delivery of projects on time, in line with budget expectations.
‚Ä¢ Excellent collaboration and coordination skills to work across
a matrixed team from various internal orgs
‚Ä¢ Effective working knowledge of smartphones, Android and/or iOS operating systems (OS), and mobile wireless telecommunications technology, including GSM/WCDMA/LTE/WIFI
‚Ä¢ Experience with automation tools like Spirent or Eggplant and basic logging skills with QXDM and QCAT.
‚Ä¢ Experience planning, developing, and executing feature test cases and functional test scripts for wireless mobile applications.
‚Ä¢ Experience in performing and managing quality assurance activities, including functional and regression testing, performance and stress testing.
‚Ä¢ Experience in identifying causes of defects, developing improvement processes, and communicating solutions to management or customers.
‚Ä¢ Experience with the industry practices/processes for Certifiying mobile products for an MNO or MVNO.
‚Ä¢ Working knowledge of iOS platform and familiarity with iOS devices ‚Äì iPhones, iPads and Apple Watches or Android Platform with experience handling various OEMs.
‚Ä¢ Working knowledge of SIM and eSIM technologies.

Title: QA Tester for NestGrid App Web and Mobile with AI Features
Description:
About NestGrid
NestGrid is the informal commerce OS. Sellers connect messaging apps, log sales and services, send receipts and invoices, manage orders and appointments, take payments, and use AI tools to grow without complexity.
Sellers can operate in three profile types:
- Products sellers ‚Äì focus on items, stock, and repeat orders
- Services sellers ‚Äì focus on bookings, appointments, and scheduling
- Both ‚Äì manage products and services together in one ledger
What we are hiring for
We are looking for a detail-oriented QA tester to validate core workflows and AI features across devices. The tester will document bugs with clear reproducible steps and evidence, and highlight UX issues that could block adoption.
Scope of Work
Testing must cover desktop, tablet, and mobile on:
- iOS Safari and Chrome
- Android Chrome
- Desktop Chrome and Safari
Key areas to test:
- Onboarding ‚Äì account creation and profile setup (Products, Services, Both)
- Orders and Bookings ‚Äì - Products sellers: create, edit, cancel, refund orders
- Services sellers: bookings, reschedule, cancellations, conflicts
- Both: unified ledger showing Products, Services, or All
- Payments, Invoices, Receipts ‚Äì including Magic Checkout Links (generate, send, expire)
- Inventory and Services ‚Äì add/edit/archive items
- Messaging and Notifications ‚Äì integration with device hand-off and error handling
- Billing and Plans ‚Äì monthly vs yearly toggle, - Calendar for Services ‚Äì double-booking checks, time zones
AI Features
- Command Growth Centre (Dashboard): executes growth commands and actions
- NestGrid Assistant (chat assistant): guides workflows and triggers tasks
- AI Business Assistant (Insights page): provides business tips and recommendations, adapts to data changes
- Deeper Insights AI (Customers section): generates customer-level insights
Deliverables
- Structured bug log with steps, expected vs actual, severity, and priority
- Videos and annotated screenshots for each issue
- End-of-cycle summary with top risks and quick UX wins

Title: QA Tester & Development Specialist

Quality Assurance / Product Development
About the Role:
We are seeking a highly technical and proactive QA Tester to ensure the seamless development of our new Recipe Database. Development Synchronization & Milestone Review:
1. Act as the primary QA point of contact for developers and freelancers, ensuring all parties are aligned on requirements and deliverables for the Recipe Database.
2. Technically review and validate all freelancer and developer milestones against project specifications before sign-off.
3. Confirm the completion and integrity of deliverables, ensuring they are testable and meet defined acceptance criteria.
Technical Testing & Validation:
1. Design, develop, and execute detailed test plans, test cases, and scripts for the Recipe Database and its publishing outputs.

Title: QA Engineer: Testing new apps

We are looking for a meticulous and skilled Manual Testing QA Engineer who can ensure the quality and reliability of our software products through structured manual testing. Design, develop, and execute comprehensive test plans, test cases, and test scenarios using Gherkin syntax (Given‚ÄìWhen‚ÄìThen format).

Perform different types of testing, including functional, regression, integration, system, and UAT.
Identify, document, and track defects using tools such as Jira, Azure DevOps, or Bugzilla.
Validate bug fixes and perform regression testing to ensure product stability.
Participate actively in Agile/Scrum ceremonies (daily stand-ups, sprint planning, and retrospectives).
Maintain well-structured test documentation and contribute to QA process improvements.
Support automation engineers by creating clear, reusable BDD-style test scenarios suitable for automation.

Title: Private Beta Cohort ‚Äî Paid Game Tester for Clap.gg (AI-powered social game) üëè
Description:
Why this is cool
We‚Äôre Clap.gg ‚Äî a bite-size social game powered by the latest AI (Boost VC-backed). We‚Äôre inviting a small cohort (8‚Äì10 creators/social leads) to help shape the product before we open it up. Think new-age Jackbox meets TikTok: fast prompts, fun reactions, friendly competition. It‚Äôs legit r√©sum√©/portfolio cred for creators and social managers.
Kickoff options (Google Meet, ~20‚Äì25 min; includes the first live challenge)
Tue, Sept 16, 2025 @ 5:00 pm CT / 3:00 pm PT
Tue, Sept 16, 2025 @ 6:00 pm CT / 4:00 pm PT
Wed, Sept 17, 2025 @ 10:00 am CT / 8:00 am PT
If Thu (Sept 18) or Fri (Sept 19) works better, say so‚Äîwe may open another slot.
How it works
Drops: Every Wednesday we release 3 surprise challenges (each 30‚Äì60 seconds).
Deadline: Please submit within 24 hours of each drop; if you‚Äôll be delayed, just tell us‚Äîcommunication counts.
Feedback: 5-min weekly pulse + one 30-min 1:1 in Week 3 or Week 4 (after you‚Äôve played a bit).
Discord (optional): Give live feedback directly to the team (engineers included).
Light physical prompts: May appear (e.g., balance a pen). They‚Äôre optional and always have a safe alternative.
Time commitment
~45‚Äì60 min/week, total ~2.5‚Äì3 hours across the cohort.
Compensation
One fixed-price Upwork contract (no milestones).
Prizes: Each challenge has a $15 prize pool shared among the best/quickest valid entries. Prize winnings are delivered via Visa e-gift card within 72 hours after each challenge ends.
Creator fit (you‚Äôll shine if‚Ä¶)
You‚Äôre 18+, comfortable on camera, and love trying new social/game formats.
Backgrounds that stand out: content creators, social media managers, UGC editors, gamers/testers, improv/actors.
You have a smartphone or webcam and solid internet.
How to apply
Submit a proposal on Upwork and answer the two screening questions in the post (your kickoff preference + favorite game).
In your proposal, include: your device (iPhone/Android/desktop) and timezone, plus one line on why this sounds fun for you.
Next steps
We‚Äôll review proposals and hire on Upwork. After hire, we‚Äôll collect your email to send the Google Meet invite and game links. Peek the vibe at Clap.gg‚Äîwe‚Äôre building a culture of play that rewards authentic, human creativity.
Spots are limited so voices don‚Äôt get lost‚Äîif this feels like you, jump in.
‚Äî Karla (Clap Beta PM), with Allie & Sean
Skills: Game Testing, Usability Testing, Gaming, UGC, Social Media Content Creation

Title: Looking for QA Tester ‚Äì Horror Game Demo (1 Hour Recorded Gameplay)

You must have access to two iOS devices (iOS or iPadOS) and will be added to the internal test group on TestFlight. You will be required to sign an NDA prior to getting access to TestFlight
Your role is to thoroughly test the game from the perspective of a brand-new player and determine whether it is ready for public release.
What You‚Äôll Be Testing
‚Ä¢	Overall gameplay flow
‚Ä¢	Turn-based mechanics between two players
‚Ä¢	General stability and performance
‚Ä¢	New-user experience and onboarding
‚Ä¢	Menu navigation, UI clarity, and ease of understanding
‚Ä¢	Ability to create/join matches
‚Ä¢	Quality of "How To Play" video
‚Ä¢	Whether new players can learn the game unaided
‚Ä¢	Whether progression and feedback feel intuitive
‚Ä¢	Any confusing, misleading, or incomplete areas
‚Ä¢	Any edge cases, bugs, or unexpected behaviour
Deliverables
1.	Full written report covering:
‚Ä¢	First-time user experience
‚Ä¢	Clarity of onboarding screens
‚Ä¢	How quickly you understood the rules
‚Ä¢	Any areas where you felt stuck or confused
‚Ä¢	Bugs encountered (with steps to reproduce)
‚Ä¢	Suggestions to improve clarity, usability, and flow
‚Ä¢	Notes on UI/UX, pacing, animations, delays, or inconsistencies
‚Ä¢	Matchmaking experience and turn response behaviour
2.	Gameplay footage
‚Ä¢	Screen recording of the first-time experience (from app install to finishing at least 2 full matches).
3.	Checklist of issues
‚Ä¢	Short bullet list of all identified bugs, performance problems, UI alignment issues, dead ends, or unclear interactions.
4.	Launch readiness rating
‚Ä¢	Your professional opinion on whether the game feels launch-ready or still confusing for new players.
‚Ä¢	A simple ‚ÄúReady / Not Ready‚Äù with justification.
Requirements
‚Ä¢	Access to an iOS device (iPhone or iPad)
‚Ä¢	Comfortable testing multiplayer turn-based apps
‚Ä¢	Ability to communicate clearly and provide structured feedback
‚Ä¢	Prior mobile game testing experience is a MUST
Goal of the Project
We want a realistic assessment of how a new player experiences the game with zero guidance. Your feedback will help us polish onboarding, instructions, and overall flow before going live.
Skills: Game Testing, Bug Tracking & Reports, End-to-End Testing, iOS, Mobile App Testing, Bug Reports

Title: Mobile Game QA Tester (Android)
Description:
Mobile Game QA Tester (Android) ‚Äî Manual Testing of 3 Casual Games
Job Type: Hourly ($10/hr to start, can be increased for highly experienced candidates)
Experience Level: Intermediate
Project Length: ~60-70 hours (flexible)
Languages for Communication: English / Ukrainian / Russian
Location: Worldwide (no restrictions)
Job Description
We are seeking an experienced Mobile QA Tester to conduct a comprehensive testing cycle for three small Android mobile games (casual genres: crossword, sudoku, and solitaire).
Each game contains a limited number of screens (approx. 30 screens total, including dialogues) and includes:
- Custom UI components and detailed visual design
- Genre-specific game logic and rules
- Additional functionality (settings, statistics, dialogues, overlays)
- Integrated advertisements (banner + rewarded/video ads)
Your goal is to ensure full stability, correct functionality, and proper behaviour across devices, while identifying and documenting all issues before release.
This role is fully remote with a flexible schedule.
Responsibilities
1. Functional Testing
- Test all screens and UI components across each game.
- Verify gameplay logic:
- Crossword puzzles accept valid answers.
- Sudoku rules and validations work correctly.
- Solitaire mechanics follow traditional rules.
- Ensure menus, dialogues, navigation, and user interactions work as intended.
2. Edge Case & State Testing
- Check all possible game states:
- Start, pause, win, lose, restart, exit to menu.
- Validate transitions between screens and dialogues.
- Check save/reset behaviour.
- Test offline mode behaviour (e.g., ads unavailable).
- Explore non-standard or unexpected user actions.
3. Advertising Testing
- Ensure ads load correctly and match design placement.
- Confirm ads do not block gameplay or cause crashes.
Test:
- Closing ads
- Opening ad links
- Behaviour without a network connection
4. Device Compatibility Testing
Test on different Android devices and emulators.
Validate UI on:
- Different resolutions
- Aspect ratios
- Tablets and large screens
- Check that UI does not overlap or get cut off.
5. Bug Documentation (Report all bugs with)
- Steps to reproduce
- Expected vs. actual result
- Severity/priority
- Screenshots or video
- Provide a final summary report for each of the 3 games.
6. Regression Testing
Re-test fixed bugs to ensure:
- They are truly resolved
- No new regressions were introduced
Requirements
- Proven experience in mobile application testing (preferably casual or puzzle games).
- Understanding of QA methodologies (test cases, test plans, functional & UI/UX testing).
- Experience testing on real Android devices.
- Having multiple screen sizes is a big plus.
- High attention to detail ‚Äî ability to catch even small inconsistencies.
- Strong skills in documenting and describing issues.
Ability to use (or propose) a bug-tracking method:
- Google Sheets
- Excel
- Trello
- Jira
- Or any preferred tool
Good communication skills.
English, Ukrainian, or Russian ‚Äî any of these is acceptable.
Basic automation knowledge is a plus, but not required.
Self-organisation and the ability to test independently.
Project Details & Terms
Platform: Android only
Scope: 3 small games
Estimated time: ~20 hours per game (60-80 hours total)
This is flexible ‚Äî quality is more important than the exact number of hours.
Payment type: Hourly, starting at $10/hr
Can be increased for strong candidates who justify a higher rate.
Schedule: Flexible, but consistent communication and timely reporting are required.
Success Criteria:
- All bugs identified and documented clearly
- All critical/blocker issues resolved
- Smooth and stable gameplay across multiple devices
- Correct UI behaviour and ad integration
Why Work With Us
You will be testing polished, well-designed mobile games in active development. We value attention to detail, clear communication, and a professional approach to QA. If you enjoy mobile games and want to help bring them to a release-ready level, we would be happy to collaborate.
Skills: Game Testing, End-to-End Testing, Software QA, Mobile App Testing, Manual Testing, Functional Testing

Title: Looking for Automation Engineer for our Agency
Description:
- Own the backend integrations that makes our voice agents and workflows run. You‚Äôll design, build, and maintain automations between Vapi, n8n, CRMs, payment tools, and data stores‚Äîturning messy business processes into reliable, observable pipelines.
We're looking to start with a single paid project to test your abilities and the working relationship, and if we are both satisfied, you will be receiving a full-time offer to join our agency. W're hoping this can turn into a long-term partnership, and as our agency grows, your compensation will grow with it. What you‚Äôll do:
- Design n8n workflows (error-tolerant, idempotent, retry/queue aware) to integrate Vapi, webhooks, CRMs (HubSpot/Zoho/GHL), Google Sheets/BigQuery, Slack, email, and payment providers.
- Build and document REST/GraphQL API calls, OAuth connections, and webhook endpoints (parse JSON, map payloads, sanitize/validate inputs).
- Orchestrate Vapi call flows: create intents, handle post-call webhooks, push transcripts/analytics, and trigger downstream automations.
- Add monitoring & observability (run logs, alerting, dead-letter queues, ‚Äúcircuit breaker‚Äù steps).
- Ship small internal tools when needed (Node/TypeScript or Python) to fill gaps.
- Maintain documentation (readme-level runbooks) and create reusable templates/modules.
- Partner with our team to scope requirements into fast, testable MVP automations.
Must-have skills:
- n8n power-user (HTTP Request, Function/Code, IF/Switch, Wait, Webhook, Error Trigger, workflow exports/imports).
- Strong JavaScript/TypeScript for function nodes and lightweight services.
- Solid API fundamentals: REST, auth (API keys/OAuth2), pagination, rate limits, retries/backoff, idempotency keys.
- JSON wrangling: mapping, schema validation, transformation.
- Practical Git workflow and environment separation (dev/stage/prod).
- Clear written communication and habit of documenting what you ship.
Nice-to-haves:
- Vapi experience (agents, STT/TTS settings, call events, post-call actions).
- Experience with GoHighLevel/HubSpot/Zoho, Twilio, Make/Zapier, PostHog/Sentry/Datadog.
- Basic SQL; Google Sheets/Apps Script; Airtable; Supabase/Firebase.
- Security hygiene (secrets management, PII redaction, least-privilege keys).
Success looks like
- 99% workflow success rate with alerts on the remaining 1%.
- Less than 1 hour mean time to recovery on failed runs.
- Documented, reusable modules that cut build time by 50% on repeat patterns.
- Clear, one-page runbooks per automation (inputs, outputs, failure modes).

Title: Document Search Engine
Description:
Job Title: Java Developer ‚Äì Document Search Engine Project
Description:
We are looking for a developer to build a simplified document search engine in Java. The goal is to design and implement core data structures, algorithms, and performance evaluation, then assemble them into a working search application.
Responsibilities
Data Structures
Develop a generic singly linked list with insertion, deletion, traversal, and size operations.
Implement a stack (array-based) and a queue (linked-list‚Äìbased).
Ensure reliability and proper handling of edge cases.
Algorithms
Implement at least two sorting algorithms (e.g., merge sort and quicksort) for strings.
Provide both linear search (unsorted lists) and binary search (sorted arrays).
Benchmark performance and compare against theoretical complexity.
Trees & Hashing
Build a binary search tree that supports key-value mapping.
Create a hash map with separate chaining and compare its performance with the BST.
Extend the tree implementation to support AVL and Red‚ÄìBlack Tree balancing.
Search Engine Assembly
Construct an inverted index from a collection of documents, tracking word frequencies and document IDs.
Implement query processing to retrieve and rank documents containing search terms.
Add navigation history (back/forward) using the stack and queue.
Performance Analysis
Design and run experiments to measure performance across your data structures and algorithms.
Present results in a clear summary (tables or graphs) with insights into trade-offs.
Code Quality & Documentation
Deliver clean, modular, well-documented Java code.
Provide unit tests demonstrating correctness and coverage.
Write a concise summary/report reflecting on design choices and performance findings.
Deliverables:
Java source files with full implementations.
Unit tests validating functionality.
A short report including experimental results, performance comparisons, and reflections.
Skills: JavaScript, Angular, Java, Android, PHP, Angular 2

Title: Playwright e2e test expert with deep experience testing browser extensions
Description:
I need somebody to help me fix a playwright end-to-end automation test for my Chrome extension that I can't seem to figure out.
---
Our automated Playwright test for video playback (Case 38) consistently fails, even though the same steps succeed when done manually. The automation logs in, reaches the lesson, and sees the video manifest, but playback never actually starts. Because of that, the downloader panel never detects any media, and the test times out.
**What We Know:**
* Login and navigation work fine.
* The video manifest is captured during the run.
* Playback errors occur in automation that don‚Äôt appear manually.
* The video element stays paused, so nothing gets registered for download.
**What We Tried:**
* Switching browsers (bundled Chromium vs. system Chrome).
* Adding permissions and adjusting extension logic.
* Forcing playback programmatically.
* Adding extensive logging.
Everything shows up fine in the actual chrome extension 'sidepanel' display but as far as i know this cannot be automated so we are mimicing that by opening the panel in a full new tab... and cant seem to get it to show up there (used to show)
Skills: JavaScript, Software QA, Web Testing, Automated Testing

Title: Automated QA Specialist for E-commerce with Bagisto and Next.js/Nuxt.js
Description:
We are looking for a professional or company with extensive experience in automated quality assurance for an e-commerce project. The platform consists of a back office and API developed with Bagisto, and a public web front end implemented with Next.js or Nuxt.js. The main objective is to establish a robust automated quality assurance system that covers various critical areas of the application.
Responsibilities will include the implementation and configuration of automated tests in the following areas:
Visual Regression Testing: Ensure that changes to the code do not introduce unexpected visual defects in the user interface.
Cross-Browser Monitoring in Production: Verify the compatibility and correct functioning of the website on different browsers and devices.
Web Form Testing: Validate the functionality and integrity of all forms on the platform.
Functional End-to-End (E2E) Testing: Perform comprehensive testing of critical user flows to ensure that the application works as expected from start to finish.
Performance and Core Web Vitals Testing: Evaluate website performance, including key metrics such as load speed, interactivity, and visual stability.
Accessibility Testing (a11y): Ensure that the platform is accessible to users with diverse abilities, complying with accessibility standards.
Security and Vulnerability Testing: Identify and report potential security breaches and vulnerabilities in the application.
API and Backend Testing: Validate the functionality, performance, and security of Bagisto's APIs and backend components.
Error and Log Monitoring: Implement monitoring systems to detect and log errors in real time, facilitating their rapid resolution.
Experience with test automation tools, preferably BrowserStack or similar solutions, is required to perform these tests. The project seeks a comprehensive solution for automatic quality control, with the ability to send email notifications for any incidents detected. We request a budget proposal for the complete implementation of this automated quality control system in all the areas mentioned.
We would like to receive proposals divided into two phases, with the first phase covering all the areas mentioned above and the second phase covering only the back office.

Title: JIRA, Confluence & Xray AI Automation Expert
Description:
Objective:
We are looking for someone that has already worked on the implementation of JIRA and has clarity in how to implement it. We know how to do it but we don¬¥t have the time at the moment. This will be configured in order to ensure that it can be deployed to scalable, as well as configure AI-enabled JIRA + Confluence + Xray environment aligned to software factory standards, ensuring that all delivery squads can efficiently manage: ‚Ä¢ New mini-app and feature development ‚Ä¢ Continuous improvement projects ‚Ä¢ Test management through Xray ‚Ä¢ Incident and problem management ‚Ä¢ Automated documentation and governance via AI Robo ‚Ä¢ Allow the AI agents in the factory to update the documentation on tickets based on the integration using MCPs or APIs or AI Robo as part of JIRA. This implementation must comply with Agile, DevOps, ITIL 4, ISO 20000, ISO 27001, and AI governance (ISO 42001) principles. Scope of Work:
Phase 1 ‚Äî Discovery & Standard Design (Days 1‚Äì3) ‚Ä¢ Assess current tools, organizational structure, and project taxonomy. ‚Ä¢ Define standard project archetypes: ‚Ä¢ New Mini-App Development ‚Ä¢ Enhancement / Maintenance ‚Ä¢ Incident & Problem Management ‚Ä¢ Platform / DevOps Support ‚Ä¢ QA / Test Management (Xray) ‚Ä¢ Map roles and permissions for 200 users. ‚Ä¢ Define process alignment with ITIL (Change, Incident, Problem, Release). ‚Ä¢ Design overall architecture and AI Robo automation logic. Phase 2 ‚Äî System Configuration (Days 4‚Äì11) JIRA Software:
‚Ä¢ Configure multi-project setup for squads (backlogs, epics, sprints). ‚Ä¢ Create reusable templates and workflows for each project type. ‚Ä¢ Define automation rules (auto-assignment, epic linking, field sync). ‚Ä¢ Integrate with Slack, GitHub/Bitbucket, and CI/CD pipelines. Xray Test Management:
‚Ä¢ Install and configure Xray within JIRA. ‚Ä¢ Define test plan hierarchy: Requirement ‚Üí Test ‚Üí Execution ‚Üí Defect. ‚Ä¢ Create reusable test case templates, execution cycles, and traceability reports. ‚Ä¢ Integrate Xray with automation testing tools (e.g., Cypress, Playwright, Postman). ‚Ä¢ Ensure traceability from user story to test case to deployment. JIRA Software Management (Incidents): ‚Ä¢ Build centralized incident & problem management project with SLA, escalation, and triage automation. ‚Ä¢ Implement AI Robo to auto-summarize and classify incoming issues. ‚Ä¢ Enable external reporting form for clients or internal teams. Confluence:
‚Ä¢ Configure linked project spaces auto generated from JIRA. ‚Ä¢ Create standardized templates for: ‚Ä¢ Requirements & Design Docs ‚Ä¢ Sprint Reports & Retrospectives ‚Ä¢ RCA & Incident Postmortems ‚Ä¢ Integrate AI Robo to: ‚Ä¢ Summarize sprint data ‚Ä¢ Generate release notes ‚Ä¢ Auto-link documentation to issues Phase 3 ‚Äî Validation, Training & Handover (Days 12‚Äì17) ‚Ä¢ Conduct full UAT on workflows and AI automation. ‚Ä¢ Test traceability (Epics ‚Üí Stories ‚Üí Tests ‚Üí Incidents). Required Expertise:
‚Ä¢ 5+ years implementing Atlassian stack (JIRA, Confluence, Xray) at enterprise scale (Over 100 users). ‚Ä¢ Proven experience configuring JIRA Service Management and automation rules. ‚Ä¢ Deep understanding of Xray for JIRA, test traceability, and integration with CI/CD tools. ‚Ä¢ Experience integrating AI / LLMs (Atlassian Intelligence, GPT API, or custom bots). ‚Ä¢ Solid knowledge of Agile, DevOps, ITIL, and ISO frameworks. ‚Ä¢ Ability to deliver under tight timelines with high quality. Engagement Model :
‚Ä¢ Duration: 2.5 weeks (exclusive engagement) ‚Ä¢ Location: Remote / Hybrid (preferred onsite in Dubai or Riyadh for onboarding) Milestones: ‚Ä¢ Design Sign-Off (Day 3) ‚Ä¢ Configuration Completion (Day 11) ‚Ä¢ UAT & Handover (Day 17)

Title: AI Automation Specialist ‚Äì Secure Engineering Document & Report Automation
Description:
Vayriant Systems is a B2B AI consultancy specializing in secure automation solutions for engineering-led industries. We're looking for an experienced AI automation freelancer to help us build a pilot solution for document and report automation. This AI system will automate the generation of precise, compliance-ready reports and procedures ensuring full confidentiality in line with strict industry standards.
Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢	Design and develop an AI-assisted workflow for automating engineering documents such as reports and procedures.
‚Ä¢	Integrate secure, privacy-compliant AI tools, open-source LLMs, local vector databases, etc.
‚Ä¢	Develop context-sensitive templates and prompts for engineering-specific use cases.
‚Ä¢	Write clear Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for client use to facilitate implementation and maintenance.
‚Ä¢	Ensure the solution can be deployed in both on-premise and secure cloud environments.
Required Skills:
Private AI Tools (Non-Public Models)
‚Ä¢	Experience with local models: The freelancer should be well-versed in working with private, self-hosted AI models like GPT-based open-source models (e.g., GPT-Neo, GPT-J) or other large language models (LLMs) that can be deployed on private servers or secure cloud environments. These models ensure that sensitive data stays within your organization and isn't sent to external servers.
‚Ä¢	Integration with secure environments: The freelancer needs experience deploying these models in on-premise or isolated cloud environments, ensuring data privacy and security.
2. LangChain (or Alternative Frameworks)
‚Ä¢	LangChain Expertise: LangChain is a popular framework for building applications around LLMs. The freelancer should have strong experience in using LangChain or similar frameworks for integrating AI models into specific workflows and automating document/report generation.
‚Ä¢	Custom Workflow Creation: The ability to design custom workflows that utilize LangChain's capabilities (e.g., chaining model outputs, using retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipelines for document retrieval and generation, etc.) in a secure manner.
3. Secure Deployment Practices
‚Ä¢	Data Security & Compliance: Deep understanding of security practices in AI deployment. This includes:
o	Data encryption at rest and in transit.
o	Ensuring that no external data sharing occurs during processing (critical for client trust).
o	Implementing role-based access control (RBAC) to restrict who can access the AI system and its data.
‚Ä¢	Compliance Knowledge: Familiarity with industry-specific regulations like GDPR, or ISO/IEC 27001. This is important if the AI tools are being used in regulated environments.
4. Document & Report Automation
‚Ä¢	Template and Prompt Design: The freelancer should be skilled at designing templates for engineering documents, ensuring that AI outputs are context-aware and meet the specific needs of engineering reports, procedures, and safety logs.
‚Ä¢	Natural Language Generation (NLG): Experience with NLG to automatically generate structured, professional-quality text (reports, procedures, risk assessments) from input data, while ensuring it aligns with industry standards.
‚Ä¢	Customizable Document Structures: The ability to create dynamic templates that adapt to different document types and ensure consistent formatting and structure, as required by engineering standards.
5. Integration with Document Management Tools
‚Ä¢	Document Automation Tools: Experience with integrating AI tools into Word, Google Docs, Notion, or other engineering document systems. The freelancer should be able to seamlessly export generated documents to the required format (e.g., PDF, DOCX) and ensure that the AI-generated content is editable, formatted correctly, and easy to review.
‚Ä¢	API Integration: Familiarity with APIs that allow automated document generation and data input/output (e.g., using APIs to populate documents with data from internal databases or other sources).
6. Testing & Validation
‚Ä¢	Accuracy and Reliability Testing: The freelancer should know how to test and validate AI-generated outputs for accuracy, ensuring the automated documents are both correct and compliant with required standards.
‚Ä¢	Security Audits: Ability to conduct security audits on AI models to ensure that they don‚Äôt inadvertently leak sensitive data or generate outputs that may breach confidentiality.
7. Troubleshooting & Debugging
‚Ä¢	AI Model Debugging: Experience troubleshooting issues with custom-built AI models or workflows, particularly when they fail to generate accurate or relevant outputs.
‚Ä¢	Performance Optimization: Skills to optimize models to run efficiently in a secure environment, ensuring that latency and resource usage are minimal.
. Client Collaboration & Documentation
‚Ä¢	Client Communication: Experience working directly with clients to gather requirements, adjust workflows, and ensure AI systems meet their needs‚Äîparticularly in regulated, sensitive fields like engineering.
‚Ä¢	Clear Documentation: The freelancer should be able to write comprehensive SOPs, documentation, and guides for using the AI system, ensuring that clients can maintain and scale the solution after deployment.
Project Scope:
‚Ä¢	Ongoing Work: Potential for expanding features based on successful pilot delivery.
Skills: LangChain, Document Automation, Natural Language Processing

Title: NinjaTrader 8 Bridge + Placeholder DLL Integration Test
Description:
I am seeking a skilled NinjaTrader 8 specialist to test and validate the setup of a Bridge and DLL integration within the platform.
The goal is to confirm clean data flow, connection integrity, and precise execution timing between the Bridge, DLL, and broker feed.
This project focuses purely on infrastructure verification ‚Äî no strategy or trading logic development is required.
The environment includes a Bridge folder, a placeholder DLL, and a VWAP-based test strategy used only to confirm stable connectivity and latency metrics.
Tasks include:
‚Ä¢ Verify connection flow between Bridge, DLL, and Broker feed
‚Ä¢ Confirm data consistency, tick rate stability, and event synchronization
‚Ä¢ Measure and report latency (p95 under 300 ms), speed 90 percent or higher, and fill percent
‚Ä¢ Ensure 3 ms buffer is active with no double-fires
‚Ä¢ Log and summarize performance metrics (speed %, latency %, fill %, slippage %)
‚Ä¢ Monitor for feed pauses beyond 250 ms
‚Ä¢ Conduct multiple test runs for consistency
‚Ä¢ Maintain short follow-up communication for any fine-tuning after review
Ideal background:
Experience with NinjaTrader 8, C#, DLL integration (P/Invoke), and low-latency data testing.
Knowledge of NT8 logging, OnMarketData, OnExecution, and order-routing diagnostics is preferred.

Title: Independent QA Auditor / Project Quality Monitor for AI SaaS Development
Description:
About the Project
We are developing a multi-tenant AI SaaS platform with complex API-driven functionality and integrations with major external services. The system incorporates real-time communication/telephony (Twilio, SIP, or similar), AI/LLM integration, and an API-heavy architecture (Google/Outlook, Stripe, Zapier, etc.).
To ensure quality and compliance, we require an independent QA Auditor to act as a client-side quality monitor. This role is critical ‚Äî you will verify milestone deliverables, oversee all aspects of testing, and issue formal QA Certification Reports tied directly to milestone acceptance. No deliverable will be approved until you certify it meets agreed standards.
Responsibilities
Review and approve milestone-specific Acceptance Test Plans.
Monitor deliverables against scope, specifications, and quality standards.
Execute or oversee functional, integration, load, and compliance testing.
Conduct performance and scalability tests (100+ concurrent users, latency benchmarks).
Validate multi-tenant security, data isolation, and compliance measures.
Deliver formal QA Certification Reports per milestone (pass/fail summary, defect log, recommendations).
Requirements:
5+ years‚Äô experience in QA/QC for SaaS or complex multi-tenant platforms.
Strong background in functional, performance, scalability, and security testing.
Proficiency with QA tools such as JMeter, Locust, Postman, Selenium, or equivalents.
Experience with API-heavy systems, telephony/VoIP (Twilio, SIP), and AI/LLM integrations strongly preferred.
Ability to produce clear, professional QA reports suitable for contractual acceptance.
Must operate independently of the development team and report directly to the client.
Engagement Model:
Project spans multiple milestones over several months.
QA Auditor will provide oversight and certification at each stage.
Commitment is part-time and milestone-driven (not full-time).
Skills: Load Testing, Performance Testing, Security Testing, API Testing

Title: QA-Engineer (Automated & Manual)
Description:
DKSR is a Berlin-based scale-up that develops B2G data platforms for big data and AI workloads. Our main product, Civora, is used by cities and municipalities to advance data models and applications in the areas of energy, transport, early warning systems, social services, neighborhood development, and climate protection.
With this role, we offer you a meaningful QA job in a flexible, remote-first environment that rewards communicative and proactive team members.
You will:
- Gain a deeper understanding of our platform and our product CIVORA than even our developers
- Write automated tests (unit, integration, smoke, load tests) for VueJS and infrastructure components
- Design and document test strategies and test paths (Happy, Scary, Delinquent, etc.)
- Perform manual and automated retests on new development tickets
- Work directly with our lead product manager to ensure high test coverage, reliable release processes, and traceable bug documentation
Your profile:
- For you, QA doesn‚Äôt mean just clicking a few buttons repeatedly to see if things still work
- You can create automated tests for VueJS-based web applications (Vitest)
- You can integrate QA tools like SonarQube via GitLab CI
We look forward to your application. In particular, we want to see professional experience. Ideally, this means you have already set up automated tests multiple times, integrated them with GitLab CI, and deployed SonarQube (or similar) in a real project.
Skills: Load Testing, Web Testing, Manual Testing

Title: Make Scenario Integration for Stripe, FirstPromoter, and CRM
Description:
Stripe + Make (Integromat) Automation for Referral Rewards
Project Overview
We run a SaaS platform (Breevy) with subscription plans on Stripe.
We already have referral links (via FirstPromoter / unique ref codes). Now we need an automation expert to:
‚Ä¢	Track referrals,
‚Ä¢	Increment counters per affiliate,
‚Ä¢	Trigger rewards when certain referral thresholds are reached,
‚Ä¢	Create and apply coupons/credits in Stripe automatically,
‚Ä¢	Update our CRM with the reward tier and coupon code.
What You‚Äôll Build
1.	Webhook Listener (Make + Stripe + FirstPromoter)
‚Ä¢	Capture when a referred user purchases a plan (event: checkout.session.completed or FP webhook).
‚Ä¢	Extract affiliate/referrer ID.
2.	CRM Update
‚Ä¢	Increment the ‚Äúreferrals_count‚Äù for the affiliate.
‚Ä¢	Store last reward tier, coupon code, date applied.
‚Ä¢	CRM platform: [specify yours ‚Äì e.g. HubSpot / Pipedrive / Monday / Zoho / Salesforce].
3.	Reward Automation
‚Ä¢	Referral tiers:
‚Ä¢	1 friend ‚Üí $10 credit next billing cycle.
‚Ä¢	3 friends ‚Üí $35 credit.
‚Ä¢	5 friends ‚Üí 50% discount on next cycle.
‚Ä¢	8 friends ‚Üí One free month.
‚Ä¢	Logic to check if user crossed a tier.
‚Ä¢	Generate coupon or customer balance credit via Stripe API.
‚Ä¢	Apply coupon/credit to the affiliate‚Äôs subscription.
4.	Error Handling & Logging
‚Ä¢	Avoid double rewards (use Idempotency keys).
‚Ä¢	Log all events in Google Sheets / DB for audit.
Required Skills
‚Ä¢	Strong experience with Stripe API (coupons, promotion codes, customer balance, subscriptions).
‚Ä¢	Hands-on expertise with Make (Integromat) for automation workflows.
‚Ä¢	Experience integrating with CRMs (HubSpot / Pipedrive / Monday / Zoho / Salesforce).
‚Ä¢	Good English communication.
‚Ä¢	Bonus: Experience with affiliate platforms (FirstPromoter, Rewardful).
Skills: Make.com, HubSpot

Title: QA Expert - Manual & Automation
Description:
About Us
We‚Äôre a fast-paced tech company building platforms where reliability, accuracy, and performance are critical. We‚Äôre looking for a QA Specialist who thrives on spotting what others miss ‚Äî from the obvious bugs to the sneaky edge cases that only surface when you push a system to its limits. If you love designing test cases that cover every ‚Äúwhat if‚Äù scenario, this role is for you.
‚∏ª
What You‚Äôll Do
‚Ä¢ Create, maintain, and execute comprehensive test cases that go beyond the happy path.
‚Ä¢ Identify and validate edge cases, stress scenarios, and real-world use situations.
‚Ä¢ Perform regression, integration, performance, and API testing.
‚Ä¢ Log issues with crystal-clear reproduction steps and track them through resolution.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with developers and project managers to ensure features meet requirements.
‚Ä¢ Contribute to improving QA processes, automation coverage, and release quality.
‚Ä¢ IMPORTANT : For now, the workload will fluctuate ‚Äî some days there‚Äôll be just a bit to do, and other days will be busier. We‚Äôre not looking for someone who‚Äôs focused only on working per hour; if that‚Äôs your mindset, this isn‚Äôt the right fit. We have a fixed rate that we feel is fair for the stage we‚Äôre in ‚Äî the beginning of development ‚Äî and this will increase and grow into a full-time role as the project progresses.
‚∏ª
What We‚Äôre Looking For
‚Ä¢ Proven experience in software QA (manual and automated).
‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of writing and structuring test cases.
‚Ä¢ An eye for edge cases and non-standard user behaviors.
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with testing tools like Postman, Cypress, Selenium, or Playwright.
‚Ä¢ Solid grasp of software development lifecycles and agile workflows.
‚Ä¢ Detail-driven problem-solver with excellent communication skills.
‚Ä¢ Someone who doesn't sit and watch the clock but rather gets the work done.
‚∏ª
Why Join Us
‚Ä¢ Be the person who keeps systems safe from ‚Äúit worked on my machine.‚Äù
‚Ä¢ Work in an environment where quality is championed, not rushed.
‚Ä¢ Shape QA processes and have a direct say in automation strategy.
‚Ä¢ Competitive pay, growth opportunities, and performance bonuses.
‚∏ª
How to Apply:
Send your CV (and your proudest ‚Äúedge case‚Äù bug story) Make sure you include this in your cover letter and start off with the word ICANNQA.
Skills: Manual Testing, Web Testing, Database Testing, Desktop Application Testing

Title: Freelance Software Tester (Stream testing, Palau)
Description:
Hi there! We‚Äôre Testlio, a global software testing company with a dedicated network of freelancers. Our testers work on apps from top companies around the world. If you value remote, flexible work, Testlio is a great place to grow.
At the moment, we are looking for¬†software testers based in Palau to participate in testing the launch of a streaming app in your country. This is a great opportunity to contribute to the smooth launch of a globally recognised product, ensuring a seamless user experience for all users in Palau.
For this workspace, we will be focused on payments, streaming, and functional testing on a variety of devices. If any costs are incurred during testing, we will fully reimburse you, alongside your hourly pay rate.
This is a remote, flexible, paid opportunity.
Requirements
-Age: You have to be at least 18 years old
-Location: Palau -Availability: Launch planned for October 14th (TBC). We will invite you to pre-launch testing as well, sometime before the launch date.
-Experience: Software testing experience is a plus, especially when it comes to Stream and Functional testing
-Must have at least 1 device from this list that you are willing to test on. The more devices you have, the more testing tasks we can assign: Web (Desktop + Mobile), Android Mobile / Tablet, iPhone / iPad (iOS), Android TV, Apple TV, Fire TV, Roku, Smart TVs (Samsung / LG / Vidaa / etc ), PlayStation (4 / 5), Xbox (One / Series S / X).
What does testing look like?
-Type of testing: Functional, Stream, Payments
-Type of work: short-term, freelance.
-Workload: Right now we are only looking 4 to 8 hour tasks. There is the possibility to expand the testing scope, though.
-Pay rate: $18 USD / h
Once the contract begins, we‚Äôll verify that you meet the requirements and then send you the registration link to our freelancer platform. You‚Äôll be asked to sign up for the project and can complete your profile with details like your devices, languages, etc. The onboarding and setup process takes about 1 hour and is paid. It includes a short training to help you get familiar with testing. Once you're onboarded, you‚Äôll start receiving project tasks directly through our platform. After the testing is completed, our client will review and confirm the results. Once approved, we‚Äôll process your payment via Upwork.

Title: Accessibility Audit (VPAT) needed for Windows Application
Description:
Seeking an expert Accessibility Consultant for a Section 508 VPAT 2.5 audit of a single Windows desktop application.
Product:
"VIVED Science," a 3D interactive science application for K-12 (see attached User Guide). It is a Windows application built on the Unity engine.
Crucial Context:
This is an older application and is fundamentally inaccessible. We expect it to fail the vast majority of WCAG/508 criteria. Your job is not to find a way for it to "pass."
Your Role:
We need a professional to perform an honest, transparent audit of the application's "Desktop Mode" and then use that data to help us professionally document the accessibility failures across the *entire product* (desktop and zSpace modes). The quality of your explanations in the "Remarks and Explanations" column is vital to the success of this job.
Scope & Modes:
1. Desktop Mode (Primary Audit): This is the mode you will test. We will provide the installer and a software license key.
2. zSpace Mode (Documentation/Consulting): We cannot provide the zSpace AR hardware. Based on your audit of the desktop mode and a review of the user guide, your deliverable must be structured to cover the accessibility of this mode as well. We expect you to use your expertise to document its conformance (e.g., noting that it is stylus-based and does not support keyboard/screen reader access).
Please bid only if you are an expert in Section 508, desktop software auditing, and are comfortable structuring a final report that honestly documents "Does Not Support" findings across multiple product modes.
Skills: Manual Testing, Accessibility Testing, Section 508

Title: Manual testing mobile app
Description:
SWAG App Exploratory/Manual Testing - Video and Live Streaming, as well as Full-Featured Testing
Project Background and Purpose
We are SWAG, an adult platform based in Taiwan. We are launching a new iOS/Android app and require exploratory/manual testing in Malaysia, Vietnam, Japan, Singapore, Hong Kong, Europe, and the United States. Key verifications include:
‚Ä¢ Videos (product showcases, advertisements, tutorials) play properly
‚Ä¢ Live streams are smooth (no buffering, lags, or interruptions)
‚Ä¢ Complete user flow: Login ‚Üí Navigate to video/live stream ‚Üí Play ‚Üí Exit, no crashes or lags
‚Ä¢ UI localization and usability: No text overflow, clear translations, and intuitive interactions
Testing Methodology and Materials
‚Ä¢ A detailed list of test cases in both Chinese and English will be provided.
‚Ä¢ App testing will be conducted on a local network (no VPN required).
‚Ä¢ Each tester will have approximately 60 minutes to conduct one or more tests. ‚Ä¢ In addition to scripted test cases, testers will also conduct exploratory testing: login/logout, navigation, clicks/swiping, random interactions, etc.
* This will involve testing the payment service functionality.
(You will need to link a credit card to make a payment; don't worry, this is just for testing; we'll handle the chargeback for you). The payment amount will be approximately 4.5 SGD (3.51 USD) + 3.9 SGD (3.04 USD).
Deliverables
‚Ä¢ Bug report: title, reproduction steps, comparison of expected and actual results
‚Ä¢ Severity classification: Critical/Urgent/Minor
‚Ä¢ Screen recording of the entire workflow (requires recording on a separate phone) + screenshots of the bug
‚Ä¢ Test results summary (Google Excel)
Timeline
‚Ä¢ Testing must be completed within the following deadline: 48 hours after receiving the build and instructions.
‚Ä¢ Revisions are allowed after the initial draft is completed.
‚Ä¢ Testing will be conducted 1-2 times per week (approximately 1 hour per test, for a total of 2 hours per week). ‚Ä¢ Testing will be performed manually based on the test case checklist I provide, and feedback on the test results will be provided.
Long-Term Partnership Options
If this collaboration is successful, we welcome the establishment of a long-term partnership to allow for future testing in other regions or app features.
Additional Notes
‚Ä¢ Please indicate your location (country) and device model (Android or iOS) in your response.
‚Ä¢ We will provide a paid testing account, app version, policy documents, and technical support contact information. ‚Ä¢ Long-term partners must sign a confidentiality agreement before receiving any privileged information.
Skills: Manual Testing, Mobile App Testing, Software Testing, Web Testing

Salesforce, and API platforms. The role requires deep expertise in manual testing,
strong leadership capabilities, and hands-on experience in data privacy,
cybersecurity, and compliance testing.
enforce testing best practices, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure

Title: QA Tester for Website (EN/FR, Fixed Scope, Multiple Cycles)
Description:
We are a small, fast-moving startup preparing to launch a consumer-facing website that generates downloadable reports (PDFs) based on user input. Our tech team already includes 3 developers and a qualified CTO ‚Äî so what we need now is a detail-oriented QA tester to verify the user experience across languages, payment flows, PDFs, and emails.
Role
You will run a structured test plan to ensure all website flows, localization, payments, and report generation work correctly. The scope is tightly defined (see below). This contract is for 1 QA cycle (approx. 2‚Äì3 days of testing + bug verification). If collaboration goes well, we will re-hire for multiple upcoming launches in November, December, and February.
Scope of Work (complete and final)
Cross-browser/device testing: Chrome, Safari, Firefox, Edge (desktop + mobile browsers).
Language toggle (EN/FR): UI, layout handling, metadata.
Core flows (for each test type): start ‚Üí submit ‚Üí result page ‚Üí free ‚Üí paid upgrade CTA.
Payments (Stripe): success, decline, retry, localized receipts.
PDF report generation: correct layout, French accents, spacing, file integrity.
Transactional emails: confirmation, receipt, report-ready (EN/FR).
Error handling: missing fields, network drop, payment cancel.
Fallbacks: if a French string is missing, default to EN.
Deliverables
Structured bug report (screenshots, steps to reproduce, expected vs actual).
Retest after fixes and final ‚Äúall clear‚Äù summary.
Strict adherence to the scope above (no out-of-scope tasks).
Requirements
2+ years QA experience in websites / SaaS / e-commerce.
Strong attention to detail, methodical bug reporting.
Experience with localization testing (EN/FR).
Experience testing payment flows (Stripe preferred).
Experience verifying PDFs / layouts a plus.
Contract Details
Remote, freelance.
Estimated workload: ~2‚Äì3 days per cycle.
Fixed-price contract: $300 per QA cycle (covers full test pass + retest).
Start: Immediate.
Multiple cycles available (Nov, Dec, Feb) if collaboration goes well.
Application Instructions
Please provide:
A short summary of your QA background.
Examples of websites you have tested.
Any experience with EN/FR localization and Stripe checkout.
Confirmation you are comfortable with the fixed scope and fixed fee ($300 per cycle besides November which will be much lighter and 200$). Your availability in the next 1-2 weeks.
Skills: Manual Testing, Mobile App Testing, Functional Testing, Regression Testing

Title: QA & Compliance Tester
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a sharp, detail-obsessed QA & Compliance Tester to help us test and refine EmpireHQ‚Äîthe central command platform for multi-entity ownership. You‚Äôll play a key role in stress-testing the platform, ensuring every button works, every flow feels intuitive, and every compliance rule (state by state, entity by entity) is represented correctly.
This isn‚Äôt just clicking around. You‚Äôll be responsible for validating both UX/UI functionality and regulatory compliance logic for LLCs, S-Corps, C-Corps, Trusts, and more across all 50 states.
What You‚Äôll Do
Manually test end-to-end user flows (onboarding, entity creation, compliance tracking, vault uploads, billing setup, etc.).
Identify and log UX/UI issues (navigation bugs, confusing flows, missing validations, broken CTAs).
Verify compliance logic for each entity type and state (e.g., annual reports, franchise tax, BOI filing, federal tax returns).
Compare EmpireHQ‚Äôs auto-generated tasks and vault placeholders against actual state compliance requirements.
Check copy, labels, alerts, and deadlines for clarity and accuracy.
Stress-test dashboards, notifications, and file vaults for errors.
Provide structured reports of bugs, compliance mismatches, and usability concerns, prioritized by severity.
Suggest improvements to make the platform more intuitive and legally airtight.
What We‚Äôre Looking For
Experience in QA/Testing: Manual QA background with proven ability to spot inconsistencies and edge cases.
UX/UI Knowledge: Understands modern UX patterns and can flag confusing or inconsistent design.
Compliance Awareness: Familiarity with business entity structures (LLC, S-Corp, C-Corp, Trust, etc.) and state-level compliance rules (bonus if you‚Äôve worked in legaltech, compliance, or corporate filings).
Attention to Detail: You notice the tiny things most people miss.
Communication: Clear, structured reporting of issues with screenshots, steps to reproduce, and expected vs. actual outcomes.
Curiosity & Rigor: You‚Äôll push every button, test every scenario, and confirm nothing slips through.
Bonus Points If You
Have tested SaaS platforms in legal, financial, or compliance sectors.
Have knowledge of Secretary of State filings, annual reports, or franchise tax processes.
Are familiar with compliance matrices or entity management tools.
Why Join Us?
EmpireHQ is building the control center for multi-entity owners. You‚Äôll be part of shaping a platform that brings order to the chaos of corporate compliance, tax deadlines, and entity management. If you love breaking things (in a good way), spotting edge cases, and ensuring a platform works perfectly under pressure‚Äîthis is the role for you.

Title: Senior QA Engineer - End-to-End Testing & Manual QA
Description:
üöÄ Join Our Growing Development Team Elevate is reshaping the future of e-commerce optimization through innovative A/B testing solutions. We're helping Shopify stores unlock higher conversions and revenue by providing actionable insights and growth strategies to some of the world's leading e-commerce brands.
This isn't just another development role ‚Äì you'll be a key team member building the platform that directly impacts thousands of merchants and millions of shoppers, driving real revenue growth through better optimization tools.
üí° The Opportunity
We're looking for an experienced QA Engineer to establish and lead our quality assurance processes for our Next.js application deployed on Vercel. This is a critical role where you'll build our testing infrastructure from the ground up and ensure our bi-weekly releases maintain the highest quality standards.
Currently, we have no end-to-end testing infrastructure, presenting an exciting opportunity for the right engineer to establish best practices and own the entire QA process. While our team has experience with Cypress, we're open to other modern testing frameworks if you have a better solution. You'll work closely with our development team to ensure every feature meets our quality standards before reaching production.
üõ†Ô∏è What We've Built So Far
Modern Next.js application with robust functionality
Vercel deployment pipeline with bi-weekly release cycles
Active development team producing regular features and improvements
Established development workflow with PR reviews
üîç Who We're Looking For
You're not just a tester ‚Äì you're a quality advocate and automation expert with:
Required Experience:
5+ years of QA engineering experience with modern web applications
Strong experience with end-to-end testing frameworks (Cypress preferred, but open to other modern solutions)
Proficiency in JavaScript to understand code changes
Experience with Next.js applications and React components
Knowledge of Git workflows and PR review processes
Experience with Vercel or similar deployment platforms
Shopify development knowledge (Liquid, Shopify APIs, app integrations)
Key Responsibilities:
Set up end-to-end testing infrastructure using your preferred testing framework (we're open to Cypress, Playwright, or other modern solutions)
Manual QA testing of development tickets and feature branches
PR review and manual testing - analyze and manually test each pull request before merge

Title: Lead QA Engineer ‚Äì Automation & Manual
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Lead QA Engineer who can own the quality assurance process from end to end. This is a chance to work with a collaborative team on an established SaaS video platform, where reliability, performance, and user experience are mission-critical.
This role isn‚Äôt about checking boxes‚Äîit‚Äôs about building a scalable, data-driven QA function that ensures our platform continues to perform at the highest level. The right candidate has proven experience with modern QA tools, platforms, dashboards, and methodologies, and knows how to turn them into actionable processes that drive quality across the entire product lifecycle.
What You‚Äôll Do
Lead QA Strategy
Build and scale a comprehensive QA framework (manual + automated).
Define and document repeatable QA processes and methodologies.
Establish dashboards and metrics to track test coverage, defect trends, performance, and release readiness.
Work directly with product managers, engineers, and designers to maintain high standards.
Hands-On Testing
Design and execute manual and automated test scenarios for UI, backend, and APIs.
Validate features across browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge) and mobile platforms (iOS/Android).
Run usability, regression, smoke, and performance tests.
Ensure database and API integrity through structured testing approaches.
Automation & Efficiency
Develop and maintain automated regression suites.
Integrate automated testing into CI/CD pipelines.
Proactively identify and close gaps in test coverage.
Tools & Technologies We Value
We‚Äôre looking for hands-on, proven experience with tools like:
Automation: Cypress (great for Vue3), Playwright, Selenium/WebDriver, PHPUnit / Pest (Laravel), Jest / Mocha.
CI/CD: GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins.
Test Management & Dashboards: TestRail, Zephyr, or equivalent.
API Testing: Postman, Newman, REST Assured.
Performance & Load: JMeter, k6, Locust.
Collaboration: Jira, ClickUp, Confluence.
What We‚Äôre Looking For
Proven track record as a QA lead or senior QA engineer with real-world use of QA platforms, dashboards, and automation frameworks.
Strong knowledge of QA methodologies (functional, regression, smoke, UAT, performance).
Experience driving QA in a SaaS or platform-based environment.
Familiarity with PHP Laravel + Vue3 stacks.
Skilled in both manual and automated testing, across web and mobile.
A leadership mindset‚Äîorganized, proactive, and able to champion quality across teams.
Why This Role?
Work with a growing team and an established SaaS video platform used by real customers.
Have a direct impact on product reliability and user satisfaction.
Take ownership of QA processes and introduce best-in-class practices.
Collaborate with a talented, cross-functional team that values quality as much as speed.

Title: QA/Product Tester Needed for templates and spreadsheets for a digital product
Description:
That's a smart move! A good QA tester can save you a ton of headaches later on.
Here's an Upwork job post draft you can use. It's designed to be clear, professional, and attract candidates who are detail-oriented and understand digital products.
---
## **Detail-Oriented QA / Product Tester for Digital Templates & Spreadsheets**
### **About the Project**
We are a growing creator of high-quality **digital product templates and resources**, primarily built in **Google Sheets, Microsoft Excel, and Google Docs/Slides**. We need an exceptional and detail-oriented **Quality Assurance (QA) Tester** to rigorously test and validate our products before they are released to our customers.
Your role will be crucial in ensuring our templates are **100% accurate, user-friendly, and bug-free** across various platforms and use cases. This is an **ongoing, part-time** contract with flexible hours, requiring consistent attention to detail.
### **What You Will Be Testing**
Your primary tasks will involve:
* **Functionality:** Testing all formulas, macros, drop-down menus, and conditional formatting in spreadsheets to ensure they calculate and operate correctly.
* **Accuracy:** Verifying that all financial, date, or other data calculations are mathematically sound and produce the expected results.
* **User Experience (UX):** Testing the product as a brand-new user would‚Äîlooking for clarity of instructions, ease of navigation, logical flow, and intuitive design.
* **Cross-Platform Compatibility:** Checking that templates display and function correctly across **Google Sheets/Docs, Microsoft Excel, and potentially other software** (e.g., Notion, Airtable, etc., depending on the product).
* **Instruction/Documentation Review:** Proofreading and testing all associated documentation to ensure it matches the product functionality perfectly.
### **Required Skills & Experience**
* **Expert Proficiency** in **Google Sheets and Microsoft Excel** (a deep understanding of formulas, cell locking, protection, data validation, and basic scripting/macros is a major plus).
* Proven experience in a **QA or Product Testing role**, preferably with digital products, software, or complex data sets.
* Exceptional **attention to detail** and a highly systematic, organized approach to testing.
* Strong written communication skills to document bugs, suggest improvements, and clearly communicate findings.
* Reliable, proactive, and able to meet deadlines consistently.
### **How to Apply**
Please submit your proposal and include the following:
1. A summary of your experience specifically testing spreadsheets or complex digital templates.
2. Your proposed hourly rate for this ongoing work.
3. Describe your standard QA process for a new Excel/Google Sheet template (e.g., what steps would you take first?).
4. Confirm your availability
We look forward to finding a partner dedicated to product excellence!
Skills: Manual Testing, Functional Testing, Software QA, Software Testing

Title: Content Migration Specialist (QA / Website Migration Project)
Description:
We‚Äôre now looking for a Content Migration Specialist (previously advertised as QA) to support a website rebuild project. You‚Äôll play a key role in ensuring that content from our legacy platform is accurately migrated, formatted, and verified on the new site.
What You‚Äôll Be Doing

What You Need to Be Successful

- Ability to follow detailed content templates and naming conventions.

- Strong written English and clear communication.
- Reliable, methodical, and comfortable working to deadlines.
Project Details
- Start date: Immediate
- Duration: Approx. 6‚Äì8 weeks (possible extension)
- Commitment: Full-time (40 hours per week)
Location: Remote (ability to work UK time zone would be ideal)
Tools: Likely CMS (e.g. Drupal or Umbraco), Jira, Google Sheets, and standard QA documentation.
Nice to Have
- Experience with website launches or data/content migrations.
- QA or UAT experience in a digital agency environment.
- Understanding of accessibility or SEO principles when structuring content.
