Title: Web3 QA Manual Tester (Developers Welcome)
Description:
We‚Äôre a Web3 development agency looking for someone to help us test and break the platforms we build ‚Äî from DeFi dashboards to Telegram bots to NFT marketplaces.
This isn‚Äôt a typical QA role. You don‚Äôt need to come from a QA background at all. What we actually need is someone who understands how full-stack platforms work, who knows how to use wallets, connect them, send transactions, and interact with smart contracts ‚Äî and who can spot when something feels off.
You can be a developer, a project manager, or just someone super technical and curious. What matters is that you‚Äôre **detail-oriented, resourceful**, and have the right mindset. You‚Äôre not just going through features and saying ‚Äúyep, that works‚Äù ‚Äî you‚Äôre actively trying to find bugs, inconsistencies, or weird behaviors in how our platforms function.
Basically, your job is to **try to break what we build** ‚Äî and help us make sure it‚Äôs perfect before we push it live.
---
### ‚öôÔ∏è What You‚Äôll Be Doing
- Manually testing Web3 platforms (web apps and Telegram bots).
- Checking wallet connection flows, transactions, balances, and smart contract interactions.
- Reporting bugs clearly ‚Äî what happened, what should‚Äôve happened, and how to reproduce it.
- Helping confirm that fixes actually work before deployment.
- Working closely with our dev and PM teams to make sure everything runs smoothly.
---
### üß© What We‚Äôre Looking For
**You should:**
- Understand how wallets (MetaMask, WalletConnect, Phantom, etc.) work.
- Be familiar with sending transactions, signing messages, interacting with contracts, etc.
- Know your way around dApps ‚Äî ideally both EVM and Solana-based.
- Have a good eye for details and user experience.
- Be comfortable communicating clearly in English.
You don‚Äôt need to be a QA engineer or have done this professionally before. If you‚Äôve built or used enough Web3 products and understand how they work end-to-end, that‚Äôs exactly what we need.
---
### üíº Details
- **Type:** Contractor / Part-time (10‚Äì20h per week to start)
- **Location:** Fully remote
- **Schedule:** Flexible (just be available when we‚Äôre testing new releases)
- **Pay:** Hourly, competitive based on experience
---
We‚Äôre a small, fast-moving team (14 people, mostly in Europe), building all kinds of Web3 platforms. It‚Äôs a casual, high-energy environment ‚Äî no bureaucracy, no endless meetings, just solid projects and people who care about their work.
Skills: Manual Testing, Web Testing, Test Case Design, Functional Testing

Short-term task TEST A MOBILE APP WITH DEFINED SCENARIOS Must-have:
At least 2 SIM cards from different mobile providers and a wifi.

Title: Mobile App QA Tester Needed - React Native Islamic Prayer Tracker (Ongoing)
Description:
## About the Project
I'm looking for an experienced mobile app QA tester to join my team on an ongoing basis to test releases of my Islamic prayer tracking application. This is a React Native (Expo) app available on both iOS and Android that helps Muslims track their daily prayers with location-based prayer times, push notifications, and various Islamic utilities.
## What You'll Be Testing
**Core Features:**
- Prayer time calculations based on user location
- Push notification scheduling and delivery (time-sensitive notifications)
- Prayer completion tracking with data persistence
- Location services and GPS accuracy
- Multiple screens: Prayer Times, Qibla Compass, Ramadan Tracker, Tasbih Counter, User Settings
- Offline functionality and data synchronization
- Badge counts and notification actions
- UI/UX across different screen sizes and devices
**Critical Testing Areas:**
- Notification reliability (iOS and Android differences)
- Prayer time accuracy across different locations/timezones
- Data persistence and migration between app updates
- Permission handling (location, notifications)
- Performance and battery usage
- Edge cases (timezone changes, location changes, past/future dates)
- Cross-platform consistency
## Tech Stack (for context)
- React Native with Expo
- AsyncStorage for local persistence
- Expo Notifications
- Custom prayer time calculation algorithms
- iOS and Android native features
## What I Need From You
**Per Release:**
1. Test on both iOS and Android devices (physical devices preferred)
2. Follow test cases I provide + exploratory testing
3. Document bugs with clear reproduction steps, screenshots/videos
4. Verify bug fixes after implementation
5. Test notification delivery at actual prayer times (may require testing over 24 hours)
6. Provide written test report summarizing findings
7. Quick turnaround (24-48 hours for most releases)
**Communication:**
- Available for async communication via Upwork/Slack
- Can test during your timezone's working hours
- Provide updates on testing progress
- Ask clarifying questions when needed
## Requirements
**Must Have:**
- Experience testing mobile apps (iOS and Android)
- Access to both iOS and Android devices for testing
- Understanding of mobile app permissions, notifications, and location services
- Attention to detail and ability to reproduce edge cases
- Clear written communication in English
- Ability to document bugs with screenshots/screen recordings
**Nice to Have:**
- Experience with React Native or Expo apps
- Familiarity with Islamic prayer times and requirements
- Experience testing notification-heavy apps
- Knowledge of timezone and location-based features
- Previous experience with religious/spiritual apps
- Start your proposal with the word happy so I know you read everything
- Basic understanding of mobile app development lifecycle
## Project Scope
- **Type:** Ongoing, project-based
- **Frequency:** 2-4 releases per month (varies)
- **Time per release:** 4-8 hours typically
- **Duration:** Long-term relationship (6+ months)
- **Start:** Immediate
## Budget
- Hourly rate or per-release fixed price (please specify your preference)
- Please include your rate in your proposal
- Potential for increased hours as app grows
## To Apply
Please include in your proposal:
1. Your mobile QA testing experience (years, types of apps)
2. Devices you have access to (iOS/Android models and OS versions)
3. Your availability and typical turnaround time
4. Your rate (hourly or per-project)
5. Examples of bugs you've found or test reports you've written
6. Any questions you have about the app or testing process
**Bonus:** If you have experience with prayer time apps or Islamic apps, please mention it!
## What Success Looks Like
- Bugs caught before they reach users
- Comprehensive test coverage of new features
- Clear, actionable bug reports
- Reliable testing turnaround times
- Long-term partnership as the app evolves
I'm looking for someone detail-oriented, reliable, and who takes pride in quality assurance. This app serves a religious purpose for thousands of users, so accuracy and reliability are critical.
Looking forward to your proposals!
Skills: Manual Testing, Functional Testing, Mobile App Testing, Software QA

Title: Senior QA Lead for SaaS
Description:
We run a modern SaaS platform and need a Senior QA Lead who can fully own quality across the entire product. This is a leadership role ‚Äî not a junior tester, not an automation-only engineer, and not someone who has only worked inside large QA teams where structure already existed.
We‚Äôre looking for someone who has built, led, or rebuilt QA processes at growing software companies and understands how to balance manual testing, automation, and release rigor.
If you know how to run a clean, predictable, professional QA function ‚Äî you‚Äôll be a great fit.
What You Will Own
This role has real authority. You‚Äôll control:
Quality Strategy
Create and manage our full QA process
Define coverage requirements for manual, integration, and automated testing
Maintain regression plans and test case libraries
Establish standards for bug quality and acceptance criteria
Identify risks before they become issues
Staging & Releases
Own staging environment integrity
Validate release readiness
Approve or block releases
Ensure critical workflows are always covered
Coordinate closely with engineering on build quality
Team Coordination
You will direct:
Manual QA (already strong) ‚Äî assign test cases, review results
Automation Engineer (part-time or full-time) ‚Äî set priorities for what must be automated
You‚Äôll orchestrate the process so both roles work cohesively.
Test Design & Execution
Write clear, structured test cases
Define regression sets
Perform exploratory testing
Validate complex user flows
Confirm fixes and check for collateral damage
Ensure coverage for edge cases and risk zones
Automation Oversight
You are not required to write automation code, but you must:
Decide what should be automated
Evaluate test stability
Review coverage
Direct automation work as part of the larger QA strategy
Required Experience (Structured and Clear)
To succeed here, you must have:
SaaS Product Experience
4+ years testing SaaS applications (multi-user, multi-permission, workflow-heavy systems)
Experience with content workflows, CRUD flows, or workflow tools
QA Leadership Experience
2+ years as a QA Lead or senior QA owning quality
Experience setting up or improving a QA process from scratch
Experience deciding release readiness
Hands-On Testing Ability
Strong manual testing skills
Ability to design regression suites
Comfort testing complex or multi-step flows
Expertise in exploratory testing
Experience catching usability and UX breakage
Technical QA Skills
Solid API testing experience (Postman, etc.)
Ability to read logs, inspect network calls, understand backend behavior
Experience working with staging/production parity
Basic familiarity with automation (not writing, but understanding its structure)
Environment & Process Experience
Has worked with CI/CD pipelines
Has worked with automation engineers or tools like Playwright/Cypress
Understands cross-browser testing
Understands how to collaborate with dev teams effectively
Comfortable pushing back on risky releases
Soft Skills Required
Communicates clearly with engineering
Thinks like a user, not just a tester
Highly organized and structured
Can drive accountability
Able to manage priorities under fast-paced conditions
Who Should NOT Apply
We want to be clear and save everyone time:
This is NOT a fit for someone who:
Has only done repetitive manual testing
Has only been part of a large QA department without leading
Cannot own a release decision
Has never managed regression suites
Has no SaaS or workflow product experience
Has automation-only experience with weak manual skills
Is uncomfortable coordinating with devs and PMs
This role requires ownership, leadership, and real judgment.
What Success Looks Like
Staging is always stable and trustworthy
Releases become predictable and low-risk
Manual QA and automation work in sync
Critical flows never break silently
Regression coverage improves monthly
Bugs are caught early and consistently
Developers trust QA, and leadership trusts your decisions
Skills: Manual Testing, Functional Testing, Usability Testing, Software QA

Title: Full-Stack Chrome Extension Developer (Discord + JWT's + Node.js + Websockets)
Description:
About the Role
We are seeking a highly skilled Full-Stack Developer who can work across browser extensions, backend infrastructure, and Discord integrations. The ideal candidate will be responsible for maintaining and extending our Chrome extension, Discord authentication system, and Node.js backend running under PM2. This role also involves secure data handling, WebSocket communication, and logging systems.
‚∏ª
Responsibilities
‚Ä¢	Chrome Extension Development
‚Ä¢	Build and maintain Chrome extensions using Manifest v3 Ôøº.
‚Ä¢	Work with background scripts, content scripts, and browser APIs (cookies, storage, tabs, history, scripting, privacy, proxy, browsingData).
‚Ä¢	Implement DOM element blocking and content manipulation (e.g., CSS selectors, injected scripts) Ôøº.
‚Ä¢	Handle site-specific storage, cookie injection, and cleanup flows Ôøº.
‚Ä¢	Discord Integration
‚Ä¢	Implement OAuth2 authentication via Discord with role-based access control Ôøº.
‚Ä¢	Develop and manage Discord bots with discord.js for user management, webhooks, and server-side role validation Ôøº.
‚Ä¢	Build secure WebSocket connections to sync Discord authentication with browser sessions Ôøº.
‚Ä¢	Backend Development (Node.js + Express)
‚Ä¢	Build secure APIs with Express and middleware.
‚Ä¢	Handle session management and authentication workflows using passport-discord.
‚Ä¢	Develop protected routes for sensitive resources (e.g., ElevenLabs API integration, Canva access) Ôøº.
‚Ä¢	Use WebSocket servers (ws library) for real-time communication.
‚Ä¢	Integrate third-party APIs (e.g., ElevenLabs TTS, analytics, blocking trackers) Ôøº Ôøº.
‚Ä¢	Logging & Monitoring
‚Ä¢	Implement structured logging to files (overview logs + daily logs) Ôøº.
‚Ä¢	Create log cleanup routines with node-cron.
‚Ä¢	Add rate-limited webhook notifications for security events (e.g., failed auth, multiple logins, unauthorized access attempts).
‚Ä¢	Monitor connections and sessions with tracking maps and cleanup intervals Ôøº.
‚Ä¢	Deployment & Infrastructure
‚Ä¢	Manage backend processes with PM2 (start/stop/restart apps, process monitoring, log rotation).
‚Ä¢	Ensure resilient services with auto-reconnect strategies for WebSockets Ôøº.
‚Ä¢	Implement IP whitelisting, proxy rotation, and request filtering for security Ôøº.
‚∏ª
Required Skills
‚Ä¢	Strong proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript.
‚Ä¢	Hands-on experience with Chrome Extensions (Manifest v3) Ôøº.
‚Ä¢	Experience with Discord.js and Discord OAuth2 authentication Ôøº.
‚Ä¢	Knowledge of Node.js, Express, WebSocket, and REST API development Ôøº.
‚Ä¢	Familiarity with PM2 for process management.
‚Ä¢	Experience with logging frameworks, file-based logging, and log rotation.
‚Ä¢	Understanding of browser APIs (cookies, tabs, storage, scripting, privacy) Ôøº.
‚Ä¢	Ability to debug, monitor, and secure web apps (blocking analytics scripts, handling session hijacking, preventing duplicate requests) Ôøº.
‚∏ª
Bonus Skills
‚Ä¢	Experience with proxy management and rotating proxy setups.
‚Ä¢	Knowledge of WebRTC/WebSocket security.
‚Ä¢	Familiarity with database handling (SQLite/Postgres/MySQL).
‚Ä¢	Prior work on browser automation tools.

Title: Technical QA Engineer
Description:
Location: Remote Eastern Europe Engagement: 40 hours per week, ongoing contract
About the Role
We are seeking a Technical QA Engineer to join our engineering team as a full-time hourly contractor. This role is hands-on, requiring strong technical abilities, attention to detail, and excellent problem-solving skills. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in QA automation and will help ensure our applications meet the highest standards of quality, reliability, and performance.
Responsibilities:
-Design, implement, and maintain test plans, test cases, and automated test suites.
-Build and maintain automated UI and API tests (e.g., Playwright, Cypress, Selenium, Postman).
-Perform manual testing (functional, regression, exploratory) for new and existing features.
-Work closely with developers to reproduce, document, and resolve issues.
-Monitor releases and ensure defects are triaged and tracked to resolution.
-Continuously improve QA processes, tools, and frameworks.
Requirements
-3+ years of experience in QA Engineering or Software Testing roles.
-Strong experience with QA automation frameworks (Cypress, Playwright, Selenium, or similar).
-Proven attention to detail with the ability to catch edge cases and identify root causes.
-Strong problem-solving skills and technical ability to debug issues across systems.
-Proficiency with API testing tools and Postman.
-Ability to write SQL queries for backend validation.
-Excellent communication skills and ability to work independently in a distributed team.
-Contractor availability for 40 hours per week (full-time hourly).
Nice to Have
-Experience with performance/load testing tools and/or QA automation tooling
-Experience with Twilio
-Experience with Ruby and/or React Native Development
Skills: Mobile App Testing, Web Testing, Software QA, Bug Reports, Software Testing

Title: Mobile App Tester Needed in UAE
Description:
SecureField VPN ‚Äì Test Assignment
It shouldn‚Äôt take much time ‚Äî approximately 20 minutes in total.
We only need you to test SecureField VPN on mobile internet and Wi-Fi in Oman, both for Freemium and Premium modes.
During the test, please record your screen and note down any bugs, crashes, or visual glitches, including ad playback and animations.
You‚Äôll also need to run a few speed tests on multiple servers.
1. Install TestFlight (Apple‚Äôs official testing app)
Download TestFlight from the App Store:
https://apps.apple.com/us/app/testflight/id899247664
After installation, join our external test group via this link:
https://testflight.apple.com/join/npmkijcQ
Install SecureField VPN (Test Build) through TestFlight.
2. In-App Purchases Check
Launch the app (keep screen recording on).
Go to the In-App Purchases screen.
Confirm that all purchase options appear correctly.
‚ö†Ô∏è Do NOT make any real purchase.
3. Free-Mode VPN Connection
Without purchasing, tap Connect to start the VPN in free mode.
Confirm the VPN connects successfully.
4. Connection Stability / Speed Test
While in free mode, open a video streaming app or website.
Let a video play for 5 minutes without navigation.
Check for disconnects or buffering issues.
5. Ad-Based Free VPN Workflow
Go to the Ad-Reward section.
Watch 3 consecutive ads.
After the third ad, confirm 15 minutes of free VPN time is added.
Connect using that allowance (no need to use the full 15 minutes).
6. Support Email Submission
Go to Settings ‚ñ∂ Support.
Submit a support message and note if any confirmation appears.
7. Premium Mode Testing
Once you‚Äôve completed the above and sent recordings + support email:
You can activate Premium mode (no real payment ‚Äî this is a TestFlight build).
Then repeat:
In-App Purchases screen visibility
VPN connection under Premium
5-minute streaming test
(No need to repeat the ad-based workflow here.)

Title: Automation Engineer - Mobile App Screenshot Automation System
Description:
We are looking for a professional with proven experience in building mobile test automation to help us scale QA across devices.
Our app is built with a combination of React Native, Unity, and Construct-3 (Web). It is stable on iOS, and we are working to bring Android to the same level in both appearance and functionality. To streamline QA, we want to replace repetitive manual checks with an automated process that generates a clear bird‚Äôs-eye view of key app screens across devices.
== What we need now ==
We are looking to build a system that
- Automatically launches our app on multiple Android devices (e.g. Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra, Samsung Galaxy S24, Samsung Galaxy A34)
- Navigates to about 20‚Äì30 key screens
- Captures consistent screenshots of those screens
- Generates a clear consolidated report of screenshots per device and build
The system should be able to run both on demand (triggered manually during testing) and on a schedule to produce reports periodically for monitoring.
== Future scope ==
While our immediate need is Android, the solution should either work on iOS as well or be architected so that iOS devices can be added later without starting from scratch.
== How we‚Äôll work together ==
- You will propose the best approach, design, and implement the automation
- Our engineering team will support you with anything app-specific such as test hooks and builds
- Once complete, you will hand over the process to our team for long-term maintenance and expansion
== Who we‚Äôre looking for ==
- Strong expertise in mobile test automation (Android required, iOS a plus)
- Hands-on experience with frameworks that can run on real devices (not just emulators)
- Familiarity with apps that combine multiple technologies such as React Native, Unity, and Web content is a strong advantage
- Solution-oriented: able to propose the right tools, deliver the process, and document it clearly
== Deliverable ==
- A working automation system that can be run on demand or scheduled for ongoing monitoring
- The system should reliably output a visual report of key screens across target devices
Skills: Mobile App Testing, Test Automation Framework, Appium, BrowserStack

Title: Functional QA Tester (iOS/Android/Web) ‚Äî fintech app, fast turnaround
Description:
Functional QA Tester (iOS/Android/Web) ‚Äî fintech app, fast turnaround
About Prograd
We help Gen-Z in the UK earn rewards, build money skills and hit goals. We ship fast; now we need a meticulous Functional QA who breaks things before our users do. Expect hands-on testing across our mobile apps and web, with special focus on onboarding, email verification, KYC, points/rewards, referrals, analytics events, and A/B test variants. You‚Äôll also help us tighten staging ‚Üî production parity. What you‚Äôll do:
Run end-to-end exploratory and regression testing on mobile (iOS TestFlight / Android) and web.
Stress-test onboarding & sign-up flows (incl. ‚ÄúSign-up started/completed‚Äù, email verification edge cases, repeated submits, deep links/UTMs). Validate analytics events (Mixpanel): names, timing, and properties match specs (e.g., sign_up_started, sign_up_completed; parity web vs native). Check feature flags / A/B tests (GrowthBook) render correct variants and tag users consistently for analysis. Sanity-check geo-based product provisioning (UK vs US) and KYC document flows (Onfido). Help surface staging vs production gaps; propose a lean parity checklist we can automate over time. Must-haves:
3+ years Functional QA on consumer mobile + web products.

We‚Äôre ProMom, a growing consumer iOS app for new and expecting parents. We‚Äôre looking for a senior QA engineer to own testing for our iPhone app ‚Äî both manual and automated.
Your role will include designing a risk-based test plan, building and maintaining XCUITest automation tied into CI, and running TestFlight cycles. You‚Äôll also test across multiple devices and iOS versions, catch performance and stability issues, and ensure accessibility standards are met.
The ideal candidate has solid experience with iOS QA (manual + automated), strong skills in Xcode/XCTest/Test Plans, and real device testing. You should be comfortable writing detailed bug reports and integrating automated tests into CI. API testing and Swift familiarity are a plus.
Deliverables include a clear QA strategy, automated smoke tests in CI, a release checklist, and a backlog of documented issues with supporting logs.

Summary:
ProMom is a fast-growing consumer iOS app supporting new and expecting parents. We‚Äôre looking for a highly skilled QA engineer to own the QA process end-to-end, combining manual and automated testing to ensure stability, performance, and release confidence.
Scope:
- Design and execute a risk-based test plan + maintain regression suite

Perform device + iOS version matrix testing on real devices
Profile performance & stability (memory, CPU, crash logs) and validate fixes
Verify accessibility compliance

- 4+ years in mobile QA, with strong iOS consumer app experience

- CI integration + automation best practices
- Strong defect reporting and communication skills

Title: Looking for QA testing for a mobile app
Description:
Looking for a skilled and detail-oriented Quality Assurance (QA) Tester to perform comprehensive testing on our new mobile application (IOS/Android)
The app is built with Flutter and uses Firebase for its backend, including Firestore and Cloud Functions. The primary goal is to identify and report bugs, usability issues, and performance problems across both iOS and Android platforms as well as compare what was built to the contract signed to ensure nothing has been left behind. Required Skills & Experience
-Proven experience in mobile application QA testing.
-Familiarity with testing mobile apps built with Flutter and Firebase.
-Experience with various testing methodologies (e.g., smoke, sanity, regression).
-Access to both an Android device and an iOS device for testing.
*What We Expect in a Bug Report*
To ensure clear communication and efficient bug resolution, each bug report must be detailed and follow a structured format. A good report should include:
-A Clear Title: A concise summary of the issue.
-Steps to Reproduce: A numbered, step-by-step guide on how to replicate the bug.
-Expected vs. Actual Results: A description of what should have happened versus what actually occurred.
-Device & OS Information: The specific device and operating system version used during testing (e.g., "iPhone 15, iOS 17.1").
-Supporting Media: Screenshots or a short video clip demonstrating the bug.
How to Apply
Please provide a brief overview of your relevant QA experience, particularly any work you have done on Flutter or Firebase apps.
Provide a clear timeline and fixed price to your proposal
Skills: Mobile App Testing, Bug Reports

Title: QA Tester Needed for Flutter App Testing on Android, iOS, and Web

Join Uni-Life as a Freelance QA Tester ‚Äî Help Us Keep Things Smooth for Students Everywhere
At Uni-Life, we‚Äôre building the social layer of the university experience ‚Äî a mobile and web app that helps students discover events, find communities, and connect with each other before and during their time on campus. Our users rely on us to give them a smooth, reliable, and fun experience, especially during the high-stress pre-enrollment phase when everything feels new and uncertain.
That‚Äôs where you come in. We‚Äôre looking for a freelance QA tester to help us maintain the quality and reliability of our product across platforms. You‚Äôll be responsible for thoroughly testing our mobile app (built in Flutter) on both Android and iOS, as well as our web app. This includes both our staging and production environments, depending on where new features are being rolled out.
We‚Äôre not just looking for someone to run through a checklist ‚Äî we want a curious and detail-oriented tester who can think like a user and help spot issues before students do. - Working with staging and production builds

You‚Äôd be a great fit if:
- You‚Äôve tested mobile apps before (especially Flutter-based apps)

- We‚Äôre a small team with a big mission ‚Äî and your role will directly shape how thousands of students experience university life. Title: üá±üáª Latvia-Based QA Tester Needed: iGaming website Availability Verification (Fixed-Price)
Description:
Hello everyone,
My name is Shafiya and I am a Community Manager at TESTA. We are seeking a Latvia-based Quality Assurance (QA) Tester to perform a specific, focused manual test on a major iGaming platform.
This task involves verifying the accessibility and functionality of our Sportsbook and Casino Provider games within Latvia. You must be physically located in Latvia to complete this test accurately.
Scope of Work
The primary focus is to ensure provider availability and game loading stability under varying network conditions.
Estimated Test Execution Time: Less than 120 minutes (2 hours).
1. Sportsbook Availability Check:
Verify the general accessibility of the Sportsbook platform.
Crucially, check accessibility on both Wi-Fi and Mobile Data. We have observed cases where the site loaded only on Wi-Fi, so dual-network testing is mandatory.
2. Casino Provider Testing:
Go to our designated website.
Navigate to the casino providers‚Äô page.
Confirm whether games from different providers load correctly.
Check both Demo mode and Real-money mode (using the provided switcher).
Test using both Wi-Fi and Mobile Data.
Requirements
Location: Must be an individual physically located in Latvia üá±üáª with a local IP address.
Equipment: Access to a desktop/laptop or mobile device (both platforms are acceptable).
Skill: Strong attention to detail and ability to follow precise testing instructions.
Payment & Deadline
Fixed Fee: $144 USD (This is a fixed price for completing all required testing and delivering the results).
Project Deadline: End of Day (EOD) October 9th.
We require clear, well-documented results confirming successful or failed loads for each test scenario (Wi-Fi vs. Mobile Data, Demo vs. Real).
Please confirm in your application that you are currently based in Latvia and can meet the deadline.
Ready to get started?
Please reply to this job post and I will send you an UpWork contract to get started. Thank you for your time and consideration. We look forward to hearing from you!
Best,
Shafiya.

Title: Parse PDF Patient Lists, Extract Lab Results, Store in DB, and Display on Front-End
Description:
You‚Äôll design and demonstrate an end-to-end approach for turning semi-structured PDF patient lists and PDF lab reports into usable data and a simple UI. The core asks are to (1) extract specific patient fields from PDFs, (2) identify patients with birthdays between 08.10‚Äì15.10 (day.month, any year), (3) parse their lab reports for augsta blƒ´vuma holesterƒ´ns (HDL), zema blƒ´vuma holesterƒ´ns (LDL), and dzelzs (Fe), (4) store everything in a database, and (5) present the results (name, last name, personal code, date of last blood test, augsta blƒ´vuma holesterƒ´ns, zema blƒ´vuma holesterƒ´na, dzelzs) on a basic front-end table.
This is a decision-making exercise as much as a coding task. We will evaluate how you choose tools, structure data, handle ambiguity/edge cases (e.g., synonyms/diacritics, missing fields), and justify trade-offs around accuracy, maintainability, and privacy.

Title: Automation Expert Needed (n8n) ‚Äì Complete & Optimize Ongoing Workflow Project
Description:
Automation Expert Needed (n8n) ‚Äì Complete & Optimize Ongoing Workflow Project
##ABOUT THE PROJECT
We are building **ReviewLoop**, a workflow-based system that coordinates paid book reviewers using Telegram, Google Sheets, Google Drive, PayPal payouts, and AI-generated content.
We have already started developing the automation with another freelancer, and a significant part of the initial structure is in place.
Now we are looking for a more experienced automation expert who can:
1. Complete what‚Äôs missing
2. Fix or clean up anything that needs improvement
3. Optimize the entire workflow for stability, scalability, and reliability
You will not start from scratch ‚Äî the foundation exists ‚Äî but we need someone who can take over with confidence and ensure the system works flawlessly.
---
## WHAT THE PROJECT INVOLVES
The workflow manages all activities after a reviewer joins our platform, including:
* Receiving new book details
* Generating reviews using AI (OpenAI or similar)
* Creating review ‚Äúslots‚Äù
* Notifying reviewers via Telegram
* Handling confirmations and preventing overbooking
* Sending refunds for paid books (PayPal API)
* Collecting proof of published reviews
* Manual verification steps
* Batch payments every 10 verified reviews
* Internal notifications to our staff group
All functional and technical details are already documented in the following link:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Xt4Sklq8GTzAaHjQ3yeuoiZpAwabGlL6gMx_aSGshu8/edit?usp=sharing
---
## YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
You will:
### 1. Review what has already been built:
* Check the current n8n scenarios
* Evaluate the logic, naming conventions, error handling, consistency, etc.
* Identify any weaknesses, inefficiencies, or potential race conditions
### 2. Continue building the remaining workflow steps
Half of the workflow still need to be completed and connected end-to-end.
### 3. Optimize and refactor where needed
We want the final system to be:
* Clean
* Modular
* Commented
* Fault-tolerant
* Easy to maintain and scale

Title: Senior AI + Automation Freelancer for Old-School Import/Export Operation
Description:
My agency is looking for a senior-level AI / automation freelancer to help drag a very successful, very analog import/export business into the present (and maybe the actual future) without breaking what already works.
They‚Äôve been moving heavy equipment and parts from the U.S. to the Caribbean and Latin America for 20+ years. The business runs on trust, relationships‚Ä¶ and workflows held together by fax, email threads, QuickBooks checkboxes and sheer willpower.
Your job: help me turn their napkins and index cards into a sane, semi-modern stack using AI and lightweight automation. No ‚Äúinnovation theatre.‚Äù Just less pain and fewer dropped balls.
What we actually need done
Think in phases, not fantasy platforms. Early focus:
‚Ä¢	Map and clean up the quoting and inventory flows
‚Ä¢	Stop using QuickBooks checkboxes as a pseudo-WMS and design something less insane
‚Ä¢	Turn messy inbound requests (email/WhatsApp/forms) into structured data
‚Ä¢	Auto-generate sane first drafts of quotes, status emails, and basic shipping docs
‚Ä¢	Build a simple internal ‚Äúco-pilot‚Äù so the team can quickly see: who asked for what, what was quoted, what shipped, what‚Äôs pending
You‚Äôll be working alongside me (fractional CMO / strategist) and their in-house team. I‚Äôll handle the people, story, and change-management side; you handle the plumbing and prototypes.
What you should be good at
I don‚Äôt care which buzzwords you worship. I care that you can look at a messy real-world process and make it less stupid. Roughly, you should have:
‚Ä¢	Strong experience with AI assistants, API glue, and process automation (OpenAI / Claude / similar, plus Zapier/Make/n8n or your weapon of choice)
‚Ä¢	Solid understanding of data modeling and basic systems design (turn chaos into tables that make sense)
‚Ä¢	Comfort integrating with tools like QuickBooks Online and similar systems, or designing a light replacement layer around them
‚Ä¢	Experience in operations-heavy environments: logistics, supply chain, manufacturing, B2B services, etc. is a big plus
‚Ä¢	Ability to ship quick, ugly v1s that work, then refine
‚Ä¢	Clear communication: explain tradeoffs in plain English, not AI mysticism
How this will run
Phase 0: I‚Äôll share my discovery notes, process map, and ‚Äúthis is how they really work‚Äù doc.
Phase 1: You propose a lean architecture and priority list: what we fix first, second, third.
Phase 2: Build and test a small set of high-impact automations (quoting + inventory sanity + basic comms).
Phase 3: If everyone‚Äôs still happy, we keep going deeper.
What to include in your reply
‚Ä¢	One or two examples of similar work where you untangled a messy, offline-heavy process
‚Ä¢	A short paragraph on how you‚Äôd approach replacing ‚ÄúQuickBooks checkboxes as inventory system‚Äù with something smarter but still simple
‚Ä¢	Your preferred stack and your hourly or project rate
If you‚Äôre the kind of person who sees a wall of manual checkboxes in QuickBooks and thinks ‚Äúthis is an opportunity, not a tragedy,‚Äù we should talk.
Skills: PHP, JavaScript, HTML5, Java, AI Agent Development, AI App Development

Title: QA / Test Automation Specialist for Backend Migration (Python ‚Üí Rust)job post
Description:
QA / Test Automation Specialist for Backend Migration (Python ‚Üí Rust)
Project Overview:
We are migrating our workforce analytics & monitoring system from Python/Django to Rust (Axum + SQLx).
The goal is to build a reliable automated test suite that ensures full feature and API parity between the old and new backends.
Current Stack:
Python (Django, DRF, Channels, Celery)
PostgreSQL, Redis, Nginx
Client: Electron (will later migrate to Rust/Tauri)
Full API documentation and WebSocket protocol reference are available
Target Stack (new backend):
Rust (Axum 0.7, SQLx, Tokio)
JWT-based auth
WebSocket server
PostgreSQL
Your Role
You will design and implement the test strategy for the migration project and work closely with the Rust development team.
Your main responsibilities:
Review the current Django API & WebSocket endpoints
Define test coverage plan (before, during, and after migration)
Build or adapt an automated testing framework (pytest, Schemathesis, k6, or similar)
Create golden reference tests comparing Django vs Rust API outputs
Set up contract and regression tests for REST + WebSocket endpoints
Define load and security testing approach (optional but preferred)
Support the dev team with integration into CI/CD (GitLab)
Requirements
Strong experience in API & backend testing (pytest, Postman, or similar tools)
Familiarity with Python (for current API) and ideally some Rust understanding (for the new API)
Experience with automated test frameworks and CI/CD pipelines
Knowledge of OpenAPI/Swagger, Schemathesis, or Pact testing is a plus
Clear English communication and ability to work asynchronously with a dev team
Bonus Skills
Experience testing Axum / async Rust backends
Experience with load testing (k6) or WebSocket testing
Basic understanding of security & fuzz testing (OWASP ZAP, etc.)
üì¶ Deliverables
Written test strategy and roadmap for the migration process
Automated test suite (REST + WS) covering 90% of key endpoints
CI/CD integration and developer test guide
Project Timeline
Estimated duration: 2‚Äì3 weeks for strategy & setup, continuous collaboration after that
You‚Äôll work directly with 2 Rust backend developers and 1 QA engineer
Skills: Postman, Python, pytest, Rust, OpenAI API, Swagger

Title: Geospatial Specialists Needed for QA/QC and Feature Extraction
Description:
We are seeking experienced Geospatial Specialists to assist in Quality Assurance and Quality Control (QA/QC) processes, as well as feature extraction using ENVI and ArcGIS. Proficiency in Python and ArcPy is a plus. The ideal candidates will have a strong background in geospatial analysis and data processing, with an ability to work collaboratively and meet deadlines. If you have a keen eye for detail and the necessary technical skills, we would love to hear from you.
Project Overview
The scope includes high-resolution orthophotography (aerial imagery corrected for map accuracy), oblique imagery (angled views), LiDAR (Light Detection and Ranging) point clouds and Digital Surface Models (DSMs), planimetric feature extraction, and change detection against the 2016 baseline.
We use a hybrid QA/QC (Quality Assurance/Quality Control) workflow: automation in ENVI (Environment for Visualizing Images) + manual review in ArcGIS (Geographic Information System software by Esri). Deliverables integrate with ArcGIS Pro 3.3 and ArcGIS Enterprise 11.3.
Looking for specialists who can contribute to one or more of the following:
GIS QA/QC Analysts
Inspect orthophotos and LiDAR-derived surfaces; document errors; validate accuracy (RMSE ‚Äì Root Mean Square Error).
Produce acceptance evidence aligned to milestones D1‚ÄìD6.
Nice to have: Python for automated QC summaries (pandas/geopandas).
Remote Sensing Specialists (ENVI)
Build ENVI workflows for object-based image analysis (OBIA) and automated change detection.
Package the ENVI project files and logs for audit purposes.
Strong plus: ENVI + Python/IDL bridge for batch processing.
Planimetric Technicians
Digitize and clean buildings (‚â•8 m¬≤), pools, tanks, towers, billboards, fences/walls.
Manual cleanup to achieve ‚â•98% completeness; apply business rules (duplex ownership splits, rooftop tanks, exclude temporary pools/canopies).
LiDAR Data Specialists
Classify LiDAR point clouds; validate DSMs; cross-check rooftop/tower elevations.
Huge plus: LiDAR feature extraction and delta detection vs. prior collection datasets (e.g., 2016 baseline), ideally for statewide or territorial mapping projects.
Familiarity with the USGS LiDAR Base Specification v2.1 (United States Geological Survey) is desirable.
GIS Data Integration Specialists
Build Esri File Geodatabases (FGDB) and schemas; integrate ENVI/LiDAR outputs into ArcGIS deliverables.
Generate municipality-level roll-ups, ISO 19115 metadata, and service-ready layers for ArcGIS Enterprise.
Plus: ArcPy (ArcGIS Python library) for batch geoprocessing and schema exports.
Qualifications
Proficiency with ArcGIS Pro/Enterprise and/or ENVI.
Experience with feature extraction, data QA/QC, and geospatial data cleanup.
Knowledge of ISO 19115 (geospatial metadata).
Familiarity with USGS LiDAR Base Specification v2.1.
Strong plus: Python (and ArcPy), ENVI scripting (Python/IDL), automation of QC/change detection, and LiDAR feature extraction & delta detection vs. 2016 at statewide/territorial scale.
ASPRS (American Society for Photogrammetry and Remote Sensing) certifications‚ÄîCP (Certified Photogrammetrist), CMS (Certified Mapping Scientist), GISP (Geographic Information Systems Professional)‚Äîare desirable.
Potential multi-phase engagement (approx. 30 weeks, milestone-driven).
Deliverables
Feature-rich FGDB layers (Esri File Geodatabases)
QC reports and milestone D1‚ÄìD6 acceptance checklists
ISO 19115 metadata packages
Training materials and ENVI project artifacts
Skills: Python, Functional Testing, Software QA, Selenium, Bug Reports

Title: Senior Python/Appium Engineer for Facebook Marketplace Posting Automation (Android Emulator)
Description:
We have a working‚Äîbut fragile‚ÄîPython automation that posts listings to Facebook Marketplace via an Android emulator + Appium (UiAutomator2). The goal is to harden the current flow, fix a few regressions (scrolling, menu selection, image handling), and complete the remaining pieces so it‚Äôs reliable end-to-end. If we click, this can extend to ongoing maintenance as FB UI changes.
# What Exists Today
* Python project using Appium (UiAutomator2) against the Facebook app on Android emulator/phone
* CLI flow that can start from specific steps (resume capability)
* Logging, partial screenshots/source dumps, and multiple locator fallbacks (EN/FR)
* Core flows: open listing composer, fill fields, select category, attach images, publish
* Pain points:
* Unreliable scroll/tap in modal menus (e.g., ‚ÄúSelect Category‚Äù, ‚ÄúMore/Additional listing options‚Äù)
* Occasional re-taps on the wrong menu item
* Image upload (from local ‚Üí emulator) and keeping original filenames
* Robustness to FB UI changes, view bounds, and dynamic elements
# Scope & Objectives
1. **Stabilize UI interactions**
* Reliable scroll/swipe in modals without closing them
* Deterministic selection of ‚ÄúMobile Phones‚Äù and other categories (EN/FR)
* Distinguish ‚ÄúMore listing options‚Äù vs ‚ÄúAdditional listing options‚Äù consistently
2. **Image pipeline**
* Simple, documented method to push local images to emulator/device (ADB)
* Ensure filenames preserved where possible; confirm ordering and multi-image support
3. **Resilience & Observability**
* Fallback locator strategies (id/accessibility ‚Üí text ‚Üí XPath ‚Üí bounds)
* Better retries/backoff, timeouts, and error screenshots/source dumps
* Structured logs that pinpoint step, locator used, and reason for retry/fail
4. **Developer UX**
* Keep the ‚Äústart from step‚Äù CLI flag (resume) and make it bulletproof
* Clear README (Windows-focused), setup steps, emulator profile, and sample .env
* Minimal, focused changes to avoid regressions
5. **Final polish**
* ‚ÄúDone is done‚Äù publish flow with validation that the listing went live (or best proxy)
* Light test harness (smoke tests) for critical actions
# Deliverables
* Updated, working repository (Python) with:
* Fixed selectors & gestures for the key menus
* Image push & attach flow, with docs
* Improved logging/retries and error handling
* Updated README with setup/run instructions and known good emulator config
* Short ‚Äúoperating notes‚Äù (how to adapt if FB UI shifts)
* Optional: a few pytest or scriptable smoke checks (non-posting where feasible)
# Tech Stack & Environment
* Python 3.x
* Appium (UiAutomator2)
* Android emulator or physical device via ADB
* Windows 10/11 primary dev environment
* Facebook Android app (latest stable)
# Nice-to-Have Experience
* Robust Appium gestures (W3C actions), UiScrollable, and bounds-based taps
* Working around dynamic UIs/infinite scrolls and language variants (EN/FR)
* XPath optimization & accessibility id strategies
* Defensive automation (rate limiting, human-like pacing)
* Playwright/Selenium (for future web fallbacks)
* CI basics and meaningful logging
# Collaboration Style
* We value minimal, incremental changes that reduce regressions
* Clear commit messages and small PRs are preferred
* Bilingual FR/EN is a plus (we operate in Qu√©bec; timezone America/Toronto)
# Success Criteria
* Script can reliably: open composer ‚Üí select correct category ‚Üí fill fields ‚Üí add multiple images ‚Üí publish
* Menus no longer close due to bad swipes; categories picked correctly in EN/FR
* Logs/screenshots make failures easy to diagnose
* Fresh dev can follow the README and reproduce a successful run
# Estimated Budget & Engagement
* Fixed-price for an initial milestone (stabilize category/scroll + image flow), then hourly for hardening/maintenance.
* Please propose a phased plan with your estimate per phase.
# Notes on Compliance
* We seek reliability, not spammy behavior. Please build with sensible pacing, error handling, and respect for platform limits.
Skills: Python, Android, Appium, Automation, Smartphone, Facebook Development

Title: Development of a Python/JavaScript (n8n) script to scrape PAP.fr and automate message sending
Description:
I am looking for an experienced web scraping developer to create a reliable and sustainable script that can extract data from the real estate website PAP.fr using a search URL, then send messages to individuals through their ads.
The script must be integrable into n8n (via the code node), so it should be developed in Python or JavaScript, with clear documentation on how to import and execute it in my automation environment.
*Main Objectives:*
1. *Scraping from a search URL*
The script must be able to perform a search on PAP.fr from a full search URL (e.g., [https://www.pap.fr/annonce/location-appartement-maison-bouches-du-rhone-13-g376-4-pieces-a-partir-de-2-chambres-entre-100000-et-600000-euros-entre-30-et-200-m2](https://www.pap.fr/annonce/location-appartement-maison-bouches-du-rhone-13-g376-4-pieces-a-partir-de-2-chambres-entre-100000-et-600000-euros-entre-30-et-200-m2)).
It should extract all the listings on the results page, retrieve the URL of each ad, and then extract all public data from each listing:
* Title, description, price, property type, surface area, number of rooms, bedrooms, floor
* Precise location (neighborhood, city, postal code)
* Photos, listing reference, publication date
* Energy rating (DPE), type of heating, property condition
* Owner‚Äôs phone number (if visible)
* Additional information (proximity to public transport, schools, etc.)
The script must handle dynamic filters, AJAX loading, and anti-bot mechanisms (Cloudflare, etc.).
The output should be in JSON or CSV format, with a clear and usable structure.
2. *Automating message sending*
The script should fill in and submit the contact form on the listing page.
The message should be customizable (with input for personalized text).
The script should return a status: success, failure, message already sent, etc.
I am wondering if it might be wise to create two separate scripts: one for scraping and one for message sending. This would allow us to handle the scraping in our database (currently Airtable), then trigger the message sending by selecting listings from the database (we‚Äôll handle the selection process).
*Technical Constraints:*
* The script must operate without a graphical interface (headless).
* It must be compatible with n8n.
* It must handle proxies.
* Include basic error handling and logging.
* Provide a README with:
* Necessary dependencies
* Installation steps
* An example of an n8n call
*Required Skills:*
* Expertise in web scraping (dynamic sites, JavaScript, anti-bot protections).
* Experience with PAP.fr or similar sites (leboncoin, seloger, etc.).
* Knowledge of n8n or other automation tools (Zapier, Make).
* A good understanding of the legal and ethical limits of scraping (GDPR, T&Cs).
* Ability to properly document code.
*Deliverables:*
* A functional script in Python or JavaScript.
* A complete README.md file.
*How to Apply:*
Please send me:
* Your experience with scraping (similar projects, tools used).
* A code sample (GitHub or attachment).
* Your time and budget estimate.
* Any questions or suggestions to improve the feasibility of the project.
Skills: Python, JavaScript, n8n

Title: Appium iOS Automation: Sign-Up Flow + Core User Actions (iPhone Real Device / Simulator)
Description:
We need a senior Appium automation specialist with proven iOS experience to build a robust, maintainable test suite for our iPhone app using Appium WebDriver (Java or Python).
Automate complete sign-up flow (email, password, OTP, profile setup)
Implement 5+ key post-login user actions (e.g., navigation, form fills, button taps, swipe gestures)

Title: QA Tester
Description:
QA Tester

Description:
We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced QA Tester to ensure the quality and stability of our sophisticated project management application, the SF: Project Portal. This is a critical role that will help us deliver a bulletproof user experience to our clients and internal teams.
Our application is a complex, data-driven platform with a 19-stage development pipeline, real-time project tracking, and a comprehensive admin dashboard. We need a QA tester who can thoroughly test all aspects of the application, from the user interface to the underlying business logic, to ensure that it is free of bugs and visually stable across all devices.
Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Test Planning & Execution: Develop and execute comprehensive test plans to ensure the quality of new features and bug fixes.
‚Ä¢ Manual & Automated Testing: Perform both manual and automated testing to identify bugs, regressions, and other issues.
‚Ä¢ Cross-Browser & Cross-Device Testing: Test the application on a variety of browsers, devices, and screen sizes to ensure a consistent and visually stable experience.
‚Ä¢ Bug Tracking & Reporting: Log and track bugs in our issue tracking system, and work with the development team to ensure that they are resolved in a timely manner.
‚Ä¢ User Experience Testing: Provide feedback on the user experience and help us identify areas for improvement.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ Proven QA Experience: A strong track record of testing complex web applications. Experience with project management tools, dashboards, or B2B SaaS products is a plus.

‚Ä¢ Strong Analytical & Problem-Solving Skills: The ability to understand complex business logic and identify potential issues.
‚Ä¢ Excellent Communication: The ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical team members.
‚Ä¢ Experience with Bug Tracking Tools: Proficiency in Jira, Trello, or similar issue tracking systems.
Bonus Points:
‚Ä¢ Experience with automated testing frameworks like Cypress or Playwright.
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with React, TypeScript, and other modern web technologies.
‚Ä¢ A passion for creating high-quality, user-centric applications.
If you are a meticulous and experienced QA Tester who is passionate about ensuring the quality of complex web applications, we would love to hear from you. Please include a summary of your QA experience in your application.

Title: Automate Shopify Orders with n8n and Stripe Integration
Description:
Project Overview Build a reliable, scalable n8n workflow that automates subscription processing across 6+ independent Shopify stores using Stripe SEPA Direct Debit for annual renewals.
Core Workflow - When a new order is placed in any connected Shopify store for the specific subscription product, instantly generate and send a Stripe Payment Link to the customer (first year only). - Upon any successful Stripe payment (initial payment or annual SEPA charge), create a fully paid order in the same Shopify store and copy all custom fields from the Stripe Payment Link to Shopify order metafields. No new payment link is sent for renewals‚ÄîStripe handles recurring SEPA charges automatically.
Key Requirements - Full multi-store support: works seamlessly across 6+ Shopify stores with separate API keys, webhooks, and configurations - Annual auto-renewal: detect successful SEPA charge and create a new paid order every 12 months - 100% accurate data sync: map every custom field from Stripe to Shopify metafields - Idempotency: prevent duplicate orders using Stripe Payment Intent ID or webhook event ID - Robust error handling: retry logic, detailed logging, and failure alerts - Scalable design: add new stores via simple config updates‚Äîno code changes required Required Skills - Advanced n8n expertise (webhooks, error workflows, scheduling, expressions) - Deep knowledge of Shopify Admin API (Orders, Metafields, Webhooks) - Strong Stripe API experience (Payment Links, Webhooks, SEPA, Payment Intents) - Proven track record with multi-tenant automation - Ability to deliver clean, documented, exportable JSON workflows Deliverables - Production-ready n8n workflow(s) as exportable JSON - Step-by-step multi-store setup guide - Complete field mapping documentation (Stripe ‚Üí Shopify) - Error handling and webhook management guide - 1 week of post-delivery support and bug fixes Bonus Experience - Shopify subscription apps or SEPA-specific workflows - Self-hosted n8n deployment and scaling - Custom n8n nodes when needed How to Apply Submit: - 1‚Äì2 sentence summary of a similar n8n + Shopify/Stripe project you‚Äôve built - Link to a public n8n workflow example (if available) - Your hourly rate or fixed project price - Earliest start date This is the first of multiple automations‚Äîwe‚Äôre seeking a long-term n8n partner who values clarity, reliability, and proactive communication.
Skills: Shopify, Stripe, API, n8n, Automation

Title: Full AI Automation for Fashion Dropshipping Store
Description:
Project Overview:
I run a fashion dropshipping brand and want to fully automate the creative production process for my Meta and TikTok ads.
The goal is simple: when I paste a product link (from AliExpress, supplier sites, or my Shopify backend), the system should automatically generate:
Clean, ad-ready product photos (no watermark, consistent lighting/background).
AI-generated fashion visuals in realistic lifestyle or model settings (via NanoBanana API or similar).
Short AI video ads (5‚Äì10 seconds) generated via Sora / Pika Labs / Runway ML.
All outputs must automatically be saved in Google Drive, ready to use for ads.
What the Workflow Should Do:
Trigger: New product link is added (via Google Sheet, Notion, or direct input).
AI Step 1 ‚Äì Image Extraction: Automatically scrape or extract all images from the product page.
AI Step 2 ‚Äì Watermark Removal: Clean images using WatermarkRemover.io, Pixelbin.io, or Erase.bg API.
AI Step 3 ‚Äì AI Image Generation (NanoBanana):
Generate new fashion visuals ‚Äî e.g., product on model, different poses, clean studio backgrounds, or lifestyle scenes ‚Äî to match fashion ad standards.
AI Step 4 ‚Äì AI Video Creation:
Use Sora, Pika Labs, or Runway ML API to generate a realistic short video (9:16 or 1:1) showing product movement or model-style clips.
AI Step 5 ‚Äì Delivery:
Save both image and video files in Google Drive, in folders named after the product (e.g., /Ready Ads/Product_Name/).
Requirements:
Workflow must be fully automated (hands-free).
Must integrate AI tools via Make.com, Zapier, or custom Python script.
Cleaned and generated content should meet ad-quality standards (sharp, bright, 1080√ó1080 or 4:5).
Support bulk input of multiple product links.
Short Loom video + brief documentation explaining setup.
Preferred Tools & APIs:
NanoBanana API ‚Äì for generating new model/lifestyle images
WatermarkRemover.io / Pixelbin.io ‚Äì for watermark cleanup
Sora / Pika Labs / Runway ML ‚Äì for AI video generation
Clipdrop / Replicate ‚Äì for image enhancement
Google Drive + Sheets + Make.com / Zapier ‚Äì automation orchestration layer
Ideal Freelancer:
Experience with AI automation pipelines (Make, Zapier, or API scripting)
Strong understanding of AI image & video generation
Familiar with e-commerce creative production (preferably fashion or dropshipping)
Can deliver a scalable, modular system for continuous creative generating
Skills: Shopify, Automation, AI Agent Development

Title: Panama/Peru/EcuadorÔºàTwo Mobile PhonesÔºâ‚Äî‚Äî Number Masking Test
Description:
Please first let me know the carriers of your two mobile phone numbersÔºàmobile numbers need to be from two different carriers.Ôºâ If this requirement is met, we can continue our communication, and you may share the two mobile numbers with me after accepting my offer.
I need to do some preparations, so please don't start testing until I tell you that you can begin.
Task Requirement: You need to be a local resident of Panama/Peru/Ecuador. Please insert the SIM cards from different carriers into two separate phones. When I tell you that you can start making calls, you can start making calls and recording the screen (both A and B phones need to record the screen to ensure there is sound). So here are the steps. First, I will give you one new number. You need to call this number from your A phone and then observe whether your B phone can receive the call from your A phone at this time. If it can, please answer it and test whether the call can be made normally. If not, please proceed to the second step. Second, you need to call the number I gave you from mobile phone B and observe whether mobile phone A can receive the call from mobile phone B. Similarly, if possible, please connect and test whether the call can proceed normally. If it doesn't work, please give me feedback.
The documents you need to submit includeÔºö
1.	Screen recordings (with sound enabled)
2.	Screenshots of your call history/logs (showing numbers, duration, etc.)
Before the test starts, I want you to ensure that the audio permission for screen recording is enabled. If you cannot enable it, see if you can ask someone else to help record a video beside you.
Also, please note the following points:
1. Check if the calls can be connected: Call the new number from Phone A to see if Phone B answers, and call the new number from Phone B to see if Phone A answers. Please let me know the result: whether both calls were connected, only one call was connected (and specify which phone call the new number when the call is connected), or neither call was connected.
2. If the calls cannot be connected, please keep the screen recording running and listen for any prompt tones. The recording should last for more than 30 seconds. (you could tell me what the automated voice message said. Thank you.Ôºâ
3. If the calls are connected, please speak a few words, as we need to confirm if the call quality is normal.
During the process of making and answering calls, it is necessary to record the screen content of both phones. This will facilitate our subsequent troubleshooting to identify whether the issue lies in making the call or answering it.
After finishing the recording, please check if the recorded video has audio.
Skills: Smartphone

Title: QA Manager
Description:
QA Manager ‚Äì Automation, Test Sigma & Device Strategy
Location: Remote (Must work UK business hours)
About Mobilise Global
Mobilise Global is a technology-led MVNE-as-a-Service provider enabling digital telecom brands to launch and operate mobile services through innovative apps, portals, and backend solutions. We‚Äôre committed to high quality, scalable systems, and a world-class customer experience.
Role Overview
We are looking for a visionary QA Manager to lead the structured transformation of our quality assurance function. You will manage and mentor a growing team of QA specialists, oversee the rollout and enforcement of automated testing using Test Sigma, and ensure wide device and OS coverage across all QA operations. You will integrate QA directly into Jira-based planning and CI/CD pipelines, making testing a visible, measurable part of our development lifecycle.
This is a remote position, but the candidate must be available to work standard UK business hours (typically 9 AM ‚Äì 5 PM GMT/BST).
Key Responsibilities
Leadership & Strategy
- Lead and inspire a distributed team of QA specialists across multiple products.
- Mandate the use of Test Sigma for all new test cases; transition away from manual-only or Excel-based approaches.
- Establish measurable quality KPIs aligned with sprint goals and release criteria.
- Drive cross-functional collaboration with developers, PMs, designers, and SRE.
Tooling & Automation
- Own the Test Sigma platform: expand automated regression suites for mobile, web, and backend.
- Ensure coverage across a wide range of devices and OS versions using Test Sigma‚Äôs device cloud and emulator infrastructure.
- Support integration of Test Sigma with our CI/CD pipeline (GitLab, AWS) to trigger tests on every build.
- Promote the use of Postman for API test automation and integration with pipelines.
Process Integration
- Integrate QA into Jira workflows:
- Ensure test planning is part of sprint planning.
- Monitor test tasks and defect trends across Jira boards.
- Align QA sign-off with release criteria.
- Ensure QA owns test documentation, structured test plans, and exploratory testing reports.
Training & Quality Culture
- Train QA specialists in:
- Test automation using Test Sigma and Postman.
- System architecture understanding (Java/Spring Boot backend, iOS/Android apps, React web).
- eSIM operations and telecom/VoIP flows.
- Drive a mindset of quality ownership across the full lifecycle, from ticket grooming to release validation.
Outsourced Coverage (if needed)
- Evaluate and engage external partners if broader device testing is needed beyond Test Sigma capabilities.
- Integrate external test results into internal QA workflows and reporting.
Technical Environment
- Mobile: Android (Kotlin), iOS (Swift)
- Backend: Java / Spring Boot
- Web: ReactJS
- CI/CD & Infra: GitLab CI/CD, AWS EC2
- Test Automation: Test Sigma, Postman, Firebase Test Lab (legacy)
- Test Management: Jira, transitioning from Excel
Required Skills & Experience
- Proven experience managing QA teams and implementing structured test automation.
- Hands-on experience with Test Sigma or similar cloud-native automation platforms.
- Strong knowledge of mobile testing across Android and iOS platforms.
- Experience testing RESTful APIs with Postman.
- Deep understanding of regression testing, UX-focused validation, and telecom/VoIP testing contexts.
- Familiarity with Jira, version control (Git), and modern QA reporting practices.
- Excellent problem-solving skills, communication, and ability to work in agile cross-functional teams.
- Must be able to work during standard UK business hours.
Preferred
- Experience in OTT, telecom, or MVNE software environments.
- Background in exploratory testing and critical risk-based analysis.
- Based in London or within a similar time zone.
Why Join Mobilise
- Lead the strategic evolution of QA at a high-growth digital telco company.
- Make automation the default, not the exception.
- Gain influence over our release quality and customer experience.
- Work rem

Title: Freelance Software Tester in Zimbabwe
Description:
Hi there! We‚Äôre Testlio, a global software testing company with a dedicated network of freelancers. Our testers work on apps from top companies around the world. If you value remote, flexible work, Testlio is a great place to grow.
Right now, we‚Äôre hiring testers in Zimbabwe to help us test our client's app, a globally known software security software provider. This is a remote, flexible, paid opportunity.

-Experience: Software testing experience is a plus, especially when it comes to Manual testing

In order to access the testing tasks, you will be asked to create an account on our platform. This initial onboarding step should take around 1 hour, and will be paid at the same testing rate of $10 USD / h. Once the contract begins, we‚Äôll verify that you meet the requirements and then send you the registration link to our freelancer platform. You‚Äôll be asked to sign up for the project and can complete your profile with details like your devices, languages, etc. The onboarding and setup process takes about 1 hour and is paid. It includes a short training to help you get familiar with testing. Once you're onboarded, you‚Äôll start receiving project tasks directly through our platform. After the testing is completed, our client will review and confirm the results. Once approved, we‚Äôll process your payment via Upwork.

Assurance Services International (ASI) is an equal opportunity employer committed to inclusive hiring and dedicated to diversity in our work and staff. We do not discriminate on the basis of gender, sexual orientation, nationality, ethnicity, or religion.

Title: QA Tester (iOS + Web) ‚Äî 20 hrs/week ‚Äî Ukraine talent preferred
Description:
ABOUT MASTERPILOT
MasterPilot is an AI-powered flight-debrief platform for pilots and flight schools (iOS app + web portal).
ROLE
Own manual and automated QA across iOS and web. Design test plans, expand automation, and keep releases clean on an every-two-weeks cadence.
RESPONSIBILITIES
* Create and maintain test plans, test cases, and traceability to acceptance criteria
* Run smoke, regression, exploratory, and usability tests for iOS + web
* Build and maintain automation:
* iOS: XCTest/XCUITest or Appium (real devices + Simulator)
* Web: Playwright or Cypress (critical paths, auth, RBAC)
* API testing with Postman/Insomnia; negative and contract tests; schema checks
* Validate analytics and logs; monitor crashes (Crashlytics/Sentry); manage TestFlight builds
* Mobile: device/OS matrix, network conditioning (offline/poor network), permissions, push
* Web: cross-browser (Safari/Chrome/Edge), responsive, accessibility basics (WCAG), local/session storage
* Defect triage with severity/priority, clear repro steps, and tight comms with devs
* CI/CD integration (GitHub/GitLab/Bitrise); mitigate flaky tests
MUST-HAVE QUALIFICATIONS
* 3+ years in QA (manual + automation) with shipped iOS and web releases
* Strong with XCUITest/Appium and Playwright/Cypress
* TestFlight experience; access to real iOS devices (iPhone/iPad)
* Familiar with SSO/RBAC flows (OAuth/SAML) and secure data handling
* Tools: Jira, Notion, Git, Crashlytics/Sentry, Postman
* English for async collaboration and live standups (2‚Äì3 hrs/week overlap with US Eastern)
LOCATION
* Based in Ukraine or Ukrainian living abroad
NICE TO HAVE
* RevenueCat / in-app purchase testing
* Performance basics (Web Vitals, iOS Instruments)
* Gherkin/BDD, Allure reporting, visual regression (Playwright)
* Aviation knowledge
ENGAGEMENT
* ~20 hours/week, ongoing; hourly contract; NDA required
HOW TO APPLY
1. Short note on your iOS + web QA experience
2. Your device lab (exact iPhone/iPad models + iOS versions) and browser/OS coverage for web
3. Links/files: a sample test plan + an automation snippet you wrote (sanitized)
4. How you keep automation reliable (flaky-test strategy)
Skills: Software QA, Functional Testing, Web Testing, Manual Testing, Mobile App Testing

Title: QA Engineer
Description:
Evaro is looking to do for healthcare what online banking has done for finance, and we‚Äôre looking for a QA Engineer (Web, MCP Server & iOS) to help us do just that.
üìå About the job
We‚Äôre hiring a QA Engineer ‚Äì someone detail-obsessed, technically sharp, and confident moving across web, iOS, and backend environments (including MCP server). This is a hands-on quality role embedded directly into our product and engineering teams, ensuring we ship reliable, secure, and seamless digital health experiences to millions of patients.
You‚Äôll champion quality end-to-end: writing and maintaining automated tests, performing deep exploratory testing, debugging complex issues, and working closely with developers to build quality into the product from the very start. If you love being the glue between product, engineering, and delivery ‚Äî this is where you‚Äôll thrive.
This is a remote-friendly role with a high level of ownership and collaboration across the company.
üéØ In this role
In this role you will:
- Test across Web, MCP server, and iOS platforms
- Perform both manual and automation testing depending on context and risk
- Write, maintain, and improve automated test scripts
- Conduct deep exploratory testing, regression testing, and edge-case investigations
- Debug and localise issues so developers can fix them faster
- Collaborate closely with developers, PMs, designers, and other QAs
- Ensure quality is built in early ‚Äî not inspected in at the end
- Contribute to test plans, documentation, and ongoing process improvements
- Validate releases and ensure smooth deployments across multiple environments
- Help raise the overall testing standards and practices across the engineering team
You‚Äôll be central to catching issues early, shipping better features faster, and supporting the team in delivering safe, reliable digital health products to millions of users.
ü§î Requirements
- Strong experience with manual testing across web and mobile (iOS)
- Experience writing and maintaining automated test scripts
- Ability to identify, debug, and localise complex issues
- Solid understanding of QA methodologies, testing techniques, and software delivery lifecycle
- Experience collaborating with developers and PMs in fast-paced environments
- Familiarity testing backend systems, APIs, and server-side functionality
- Comfortable working across multiple environments and tools
‚≠ê Nice to Have
- Experience with MCP server environments
- Background in testing healthcare, fintech, or other regulated systems
- Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and test automation frameworks
- Understanding of performance testing or advanced debugging tools
- Experience contributing to QA strategy, processes, or tooling selection
üéÅ Perks
- Competitive hourly or salary compensation (dependent on experience)
- Flexible remote working environment
- Opportunities for growth across QA, automation, and technical areas
- Be part of a tight-knit, high-impact engineering team
üè• About Evaro
Evaro builds technology that makes healthcare more accessible. Our platform enables brands to integrate digital health services with minimal friction, supporting **13.5 million** patients across NHS and private healthcare services in the UK.
We were founded in 2018 by Dr Thuria Wenbar and Dr Oskar Wenbar after realising that 25% of A&E consultations and 40% of GP appointments focus on minor health conditions that could be more efficiently managed digitally. What began as an e-Surgery and e-Pharmacy platform has grown into a full-stack digital health company, powering clinical, operational, and product solutions for the future of healthcare.
Our mission is to improve access to medications and health services through seamless, tech-driven experiences. We‚Äôre building the online banking for UK healthcare ‚Äì and we‚Äôd love for you to help us make it a reality.
üí¨ Application Process
If you‚Äôre interested in working with us, here‚Äôs what to expect:
1. Intro call with our Talent Partner (Sofi)
2. Technical Assessment (paid)
3. Technical interview with QA Engineers
4. Offer üéâ

Title: Automation Tester/Engineer
Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Automation Engineer to design, implement, and maintain automated testing frameworks that ensure the reliability, security, and usability of our applications. This role will focus on building a solid testing strategy across back-end and front-end systems, with a strong emphasis on unit, integration, and end-to-end coverage.
Key Responsibilities
- Develop, maintain, and scale automated test suites across Back-end (API) and Front-end technologies.
- Implement and enforce a Testing Pyramid strategy:
- Unit Tests (PHPUnit): business rules, validators, helpers.
- Integration Tests (PHPUnit): database, mail, queues, HTTP controllers.
- E2E Tests (Playwright): real-browser flows for critical forms.
- Drive test coverage with a focus on unit + integration tests; use E2E tests for happy paths and high-risk edge cases.
- Establish best practices for test design, including equivalence partitioning, boundary analysis, and cross-field rule validation.
- Collaborate with developers, QA, and product managers to define test strategies and acceptance criteria.
- Integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines to ensure consistent quality at scale.
- Document testing frameworks, patterns, and strategies for long-term maintainability.
Areas of Focus
- Data Validation & Rules:
- Empty vs. filled states, min/max length, allowed/forbidden characters.
- Invalid email/phone formats, numeric ranges, past/future dates, multi-select limits.
Cross-Field Logic:
- Password/confirm match, start/end dates, conditional required fields.
Security:
- CSRF protections, server-side validation matching client rules.
- Rejecting unknown fields (prevent over-posting).
- Rate-limiting abusive submissions.
Usability & Accessibility (a11y):
- Keyboard-only navigation, correct focus order.
- Error summary linked to fields, aria-invalid attributes, live regions for errors/success.
Internationalization (i18n):
- RTL support, localized messages, number/date parsing.
Resilience:
- Handling slow networks gracefully.
- Retry idempotency for requests.
- Duplicate submission protection.
Qualifications
- Proven experience in automation engineering with both back-end APIs and front-end applications.
- Strong knowledge of PHPUnit for unit and integration testing.
- Experience with Playwright (or similar frameworks like Cypress, Selenium, Puppeteer) for E2E testing.
Solid understanding of software testing principles (testing pyramid, equivalence partitioning, boundary testing).
Familiarity with accessibility (WCAG), security best practices, and usability testing.
Hands-on experience integrating automated tests into CI/CD pipelines.
Strong problem-solving, debugging, and analytical skills.
Nice-to-Have Skills
Familiarity with internationalization (i18n) and localization testing.
Knowledge of performance testing and load simulation.
Experience working in agile environments with DevOps practices.
Skills: SQLite, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Automated Testing

Title: Technical Co-Founder / Automation Engineering Partner Needed for AI-Powered Business Solutions
Description:
I'm the founder of yourAIarch, an AI-powered architecture and automation consulting firm. I'm seeking a long-term technical partner to build and maintain sophisticated automation systems that will transform how businesses operate. I am based in NYC and have made connections in this space. I am new to the market but have a lot of experience in marketing and ongoing support from mentors. Please read the description below and feel free to reach out to me if you have questions.
youraiarch.com
About the Role
This is NOT a one-off project‚ÄîI'm looking for an ongoing partnership with someone who can serve as the technical backbone of our automation practice. You'll be responsible for building, and maintaining automation solutions while I focus on client relationships and business development.
What We're Building
Automation services include:
1. Email Automation & Campaigns - Multi-channel nurture sequences with dynamic content personalization, behavioral triggers, A/B testing, and advanced segmentation
2. AI Call Agents - Conversational AI voice systems for customer support, lead qualification, appointment scheduling, and follow-ups with natural language processing
3. Lead Qualification & Routing - Intelligent lead scoring systems that automatically route prospects to appropriate sales teams based on behavior, demographics, and engagement
4. Custom Workflow Automation - End-to-end process automation connecting disparate systems, eliminating manual tasks, and streamlining operations across departments
5. CRM & System Integration - Seamless data synchronization between CRMs, marketing platforms, project management tools, and custom databases
6. AI-Powered Analytics & Insights - Real-time dashboards, predictive analytics, automated reporting, and actionable intelligence from business data
Technical Requirements
Have expertise in:
- AI/ML Integration: OpenAI API, Anthropic Claude, Google Gemini, or similar LLM platforms; prompt engineering and RAG systems
