Title: QA Tester (Web Applications)
Description:
We are seeking a skilled and self-motivated freelance QA Tester to take ownership of the quality assurance for our web applications. You will be a crucial part of our development cycle, working closely with our developers to test new features, identify issues, and verify fixes. Your primary responsibility will be to design, write, and execute manual test cases to ensure our applications meet our high standards of quality.
Of course. Here is a comprehensive job description for a freelance software tester, tailored to your requirements. You can adjust the details in the brackets [...] to fit your specific needs.
Job Title: Freelance QA Tester (Web Applications)
Company: [Your Company/Project Name]
Location: Remote
Job Type: Contract / Freelance
About Us
[Your Company/Project Name] is a [describe your team or company, e.g., small, agile team] focused on building high-quality, user-friendly web applications. We are passionate about creating excellent products and believe that rigorous testing is a critical part of the development process. We are looking for a detail-oriented freelance tester to help us ensure our software is robust, reliable, and bug-free before it reaches our users.
The Opportunity
We are seeking a skilled and self-motivated freelance QA Tester to take ownership of the quality assurance for our web applications. You will be a crucial part of our development cycle, working closely with our developers to test new features, identify issues, and verify fixes. Your primary responsibility will be to design, write, and execute manual test cases to ensure our applications meet our high standards of quality.
Key Responsibilities
Develop, document, and maintain clear, concise, and comprehensive test cases and test plans.
Manually execute test cases for new features and bug fixes across various web browsers (e.g., Chrome, Firefox, Safari) .
Identify, record, and thoroughly document bugs using our issue tracking system GitHub Issues
Perform thorough regression testing when bugs are resolved to ensure that fixes are effective and have not introduced new issues.
Review product requirements and specifications to provide timely and meaningful feedback from a quality perspective.
Communicate test results, bug reports, and quality concerns clearly to the development team.
Required Skills & Qualifications
Proven experience as a Software Tester, QA Analyst, or similar role.
Strong experience in manual testing of web applications.
Expertise in creating detailed, comprehensive, and well-structured test cases.
Familiarity with bug tracking software (e.g., Jira, Trello, Asana, GitHub Issues).
Excellent attention to detail, analytical mind, and problem-solving skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work independently and manage your own time effectively.
Preferred Qualifications (A Big Plus)
Experience with Git: You should be comfortable with basic Git workflows, such as pulling the latest changes and checking out different branches for testing.
Familiarity with Python and Django: A basic understanding of the Django framework will be highly beneficial for understanding the application's structure and communicating more effectively with our developers.
Basic knowledge of web technologies like HTML, CSS, and browser developer tools.
Project Details
Hours: We anticipate needing approximately [e.g., 10-15] hours per week, with flexibility based on our development sprints.
Please briefly describe your experience testing a web application and mention a particularly interesting or challenging bug you've found and how you reported it.
Skills: Test Case Design, Test Execution, Software QA, Manual Testing, Functional Testing

Title: Website QA Tester
Description:
Rate: $10‚Äì$18 per hour (depending on experience)
Location: Remote
Type: Freelance / Part-time
About Us
Atomic Digital Marketing (atomicdigitalmarketing.co.uk) is a fast-growing UK-based digital marketing agency. We build high-performing, design-led websites for clients across a wide range of industries.
We‚Äôre looking for a freelance QA tester to help us review and test our developed websites before launch ‚Äî ensuring they perfectly match the design files, function flawlessly, and deliver an excellent user experience.
Role Overview
This is not a developer or designer role, but an eye for detail is essential. You‚Äôll compare finished websites to their Figma designs, checking everything from spacing and typography to colour accuracy and animations. You‚Äôll also test forms, buttons, navigation, and interactive elements to ensure everything works as intended.
Design and dev experience is not required, but would be a plus as it helps when spotting layout and aesthetic issues.
Responsibilities
- Compare live/staging websites against Figma designs to ensure a pixel-perfect match.
- Check layout accuracy ‚Äî spacing, padding, font sizes, colours, and alignment.
- Test all interactive elements ‚Äî buttons, forms, links, menus, animations, and effects.
- Review animations (GSAP or CSS) to confirm smoothness, responsiveness, and adherence to design.
- Test websites across devices (desktop, tablet, mobile) and browsers for responsiveness and compatibility.
- Log clear, actionable feedback for the development team.
- Retest after fixes to confirm issues are resolved.
Requirements
- Strong attention to detail ‚Äî able to spot even small design and functional inconsistencies.
- Experience with website QA or front-end review (agency experience a plus).
- Familiarity with design-to-development workflows (Figma knowledge preferred).
- Comfortable testing on multiple devices and browsers.
- Strong communication skills for providing concise, structured feedback.
Nice-to-Have Skills
- Background in web design or front-end development.
- Familiarity with animation libraries like GSAP (for testing animation accuracy).
- Understanding of basic HTML/CSS for communicating issues more effectively.
What We Offer
- Flexible remote working.
- Consistent freelance work on varied, high-quality web projects.
- Collaborative team environment.
- Clear design files and staging links for every project.

Title: QA Automation Engineer
Description:
We are seeking a QA Automation Engineer to own our end-to-end quality architecture and build a robust, low-flake test stack. You will combine Playwright E2E tests with real-device coverage via BrowserStack, visual regression with Percy, and LLM evaluation suites for our AI features. This role requires strong technical skills, ownership mentality, and the ability to establish quality gates that scale with our growing platform.
Key Responsibilities:
-Design and evolve a comprehensive testing pyramid across our micro-frontend stack (Next.js + React) and Supabase-backed APIs
-Author resilient Playwright tests for critical user paths including sign-in, transaction creation, timeline/milestone tracking, and document handling
-Integrate BrowserStack for cross-browser and real-device coverage with optimized concurrency for CI throughput
-Implement Percy visual testing on pull requests with defined ignore regions, thresholds, and efficient diff triage
-Introduce and maintain LLM evaluation frameworks (DeepEval, Promptfoo, or LangSmith) to gate AI behavior with golden datasets
-Build and optimize GitHub Actions pipelines with sharded test runs, artifact collection, flaky test quarantine, and branch protections
-Establish deterministic test data strategies using factories/fixtures for Supabase with seed and reset patterns for local/CI/staging environments
-Optionally pilot autonomous testing tools (e.g., testRigor or Virtuoso) for nightly exploratory coverage
-Instrument QA observability dashboards to track pass rates, flake rates, and visual noise while driving continuous improvements
Mandatory Requirements:
-3-7+ years of experience in test automation with strong TypeScript and Playwright expertise (or Cypress with willingness to transition to Playwright) ‚Äì MUST
-Hands-on experience with BrowserStack or similar real-device cloud platforms for cross-browser/device coverage and CI integration
-Proven expertise in visual testing tools, specifically configuring Percy (baselines, thresholds, ignore regions) at scale
-Strong CI/CD ownership with GitHub Actions including matrix builds, caching, artifacts, and required checks
-Experience with API testing and contracts (OpenAPI/JSON Schema), and property-based testing where appropriate
-Proficiency in data seeding/fixtures and environment management across local, staging, and production
-Excellent written communication skills and ability to turn vague bug reports into minimal, reproducible test cases
Preferred Skills:
-Experience with LLM evaluation frameworks (DeepEval, Promptfoo, or LangSmith) including metrics selection and golden dataset creation
-Familiarity with Supabase/Postgres and authentication flows; basic SQL for seeding and data inspection
-Knowledge of model-based testing approaches (XState/Stately, GraphWalker, or similar MBT tools)
-Experience with autonomous testing platforms (testRigor, Virtuoso, mabl, Tricentis Testim)
-Java/JUnit exposure for collaboration with automated unit test generation tools
-Understanding of n8n workflows, SendGrid templating, and timeline/queue systems
Why Join Us?
-Work on a modern tech stack with cutting-edge testing tools and AI-accelerated quality practices
-Own the quality architecture for a fast-growing real-estate technology platform
-Collaborate with a team that values automation, reliability, and continuous improvement
-Make a tangible impact on product quality and user experience
-Build expertise in emerging areas like LLM evaluation and autonomous testing
If you have the technical expertise and passion for quality engineering to elevate our testing infrastructure, apply now and help us build a world-class QA practice!
Skills: TypeScript, Automated Testing, QA Automation

Title: Mobile Web Location-Permission Flow on Brazilian Sites
Description:

‚Äì Any recurring prompts or auto-rechecks (e.g., every 30 min).
‚Äì Paths to re-enable location if the user clicks Deny.
‚Äì VPN warnings / geo-blocks and the related network calls.
2. Scope of Work (High-Level)
Run two short flows per brand:
‚Äì Allow the first geo-prompt and record key steps.
‚Äì Deny the first geo-prompt and record key steps.
Keep DevTools ‚Üí Network open and export a HAR at each major checkpoint.
Record screen (1080p, 30 fps) and take screenshots of every location prompt, VPN message, or error.

‚Äì No deposits / withdrawals required.
‚Äì Pause the recording during any KYC selfie / document upload and resume immediately after.
‚Äì Mask or blur all personal data (CPF, phone etc.).
‚Äì We only need evidence of geolocation prompts and network requests; we do not store or use your personal info.

Tester:
‚Äì Must be physically in Brazil (Brazilian IP).

‚Äì Comfortable toggling a VPN (ON ‚Üí US / EU node ‚Üí OFF) during the test.

‚Äì Chrome, Incognito mode, cache & cookies cleared.
‚Äì Screen-record app (1080p, 30 fps, with sound).
‚Äì Ability to open Chrome DevTools on mobile and export HAR files.

Betano, Bet365, Superbet, Betnacional, EsportesDaSorte (URLs in full brief)
Testing scope is flexible: you may cover one, several, or all of the sites listed. Please state exactly which brands you can test when you apply.
Pricing is calculated per site (20 USD):
‚Äì 1 site = one complete package (Allow + Deny flows, videos, screenshots, HAR files, spreadsheet row).

Title: User Testing for Mobile Website Wine Taste Quiz (UK only)
Description:
We are seeking a few UK based (your current location must be in the UK) user testers to complete our online wine taste quiz. Your task will involve screen recording your phone screen with your microphone on and thinking out loud as you complete the quiz and get the results. You will be completing a short quiz about figuring out your wine taste, and providing comprehensive feedback on the overall flow from a user perspective. We want to understand the user experience, interface usability, any potential issues, and suggestions for improvement. Ideal candidates should have a keen eye for detail, be able to express their thoughts out loud, and a slight interest or curiosity in wine. Your insights will be invaluable in optimizing our quiz for better user engagement and quiz results.

You will deliver a video of the screen recording with audio (your thoughts as you complete the quiz) as well as some notes that summarizes your experience of the quiz and result.
The process for the selected are to record on their phone screen:
- Clicking on an image that links to the quiz
- Completing the wine quiz questions
- Reading the quiz result on the page, submitting your email address to unlock the full result
- Opening an email with the result, and interpreting it. If you want, you can pause/block when you open your email, but we need to see the email result and whatever you choose to click on in the email. This email could end up in your spam folder. For the assignment to be completed we need a video including the email result.

Title: QA and UX Tester for Real Estate Marketplace
Description:
RehabLoop.com is a specialized platform for real estate investors to buy, sell, and trade off-market properties. The site features multiple membership tiers, complex property listing and moderation workflows, user profiles, saved searches, and automated email notifications.
Your Role & Responsibilities:
We require a thorough, end-to-end testing of all user-facing features. While a detailed testing plan will be provided, the core tasks will involve:
1.	Account Management: Creating and testing the functionality of various user accounts (e.g., Free Basic Member, VIP Member, Moderator).
2.	User Flows: Simulating real-world interactions, such as:
o	A seller posting a property for sale.
o	A moderator reviewing, approving, holding, or contracting a property.
o	A buyer saving property searches and receiving email alerts.
o	A buyer contacting a seller through the platform and testing the messaging sequence.
3.	Verification: Meticulously checking that all automated emails (notifications, alerts, confirmations) are triggered correctly, sent to the right user, and contain the correct information.
4.	SEO Validation: Verifying that our platform correctly auto-generates SEO-friendly URLs, meta titles, and meta descriptions for property listings and user profiles according to specific rules.
5.	Bug Reporting: Identifying, documenting, and clearly reporting any bugs, logical errors, or UI/UX inconsistencies.
Who We Are Looking For:
‚Ä¢	Individuals with proven experience in manual web application testing and QA.
‚Ä¢	Extremely detail-oriented with a methodical approach to testing complex workflows.
‚Ä¢	Excellent communication skills for clear and concise bug reporting.
‚Ä¢	Self-starters who can work efficiently and meet deadlines.
‚Ä¢	Experience with real estate platforms is a plus, but not required.
How to Apply:
If you are interested in this project, please reply with the following:
1.	A brief summary of your skills and relevant testing experience.
2.	Links to your portfolio or examples of past work if available.
3.	Your estimated cost for completing this project. Please provide a flat project fee.
4.	Your estimated timeframe for completion.
You can view the live site here: https://rehabloop.com
We have a detailed test plan ready to ensure you can get started quickly and efficiently. We look forward to collaborating with you to make RehabLoop.com a success.
Thank you.

We‚Äôre preparing for a high-stakes pre-beta launch of a next-gen fashion-tech app (iOS + Android + Web) built at the intersection of fashion and AI.
We‚Äôre looking for a meticulous QA specialist who thrives on precision - someone who can validate every flow, every pixel, and every payment across devices, OS versions, and browsers on our latest builds to ensure a stable, secure, and confident launch.
This is a short, structured sprint with real impact: your work will determine whether we go live confidently or stall at the gate. You‚Äôll collaborate closely with our distributed dev team, get access to Firebase, Razorpay sandbox, and restricted GCP modules, and play a key role in making the product bulletproof before launch.
Scope of Work
You‚Äôll own QA across iOS, Android, and Web on our latest builds in Light & Dark Modes, covering:
1. Functional & UI Testing
‚Ä¢	Onboarding flows, persona logic, and profile journeys
‚Ä¢	Conversational AI interface behavior
‚Ä¢	Wardrobe save/edit/tag functions
‚Ä¢	Subscription and payment success/failure/retry flows
‚Ä¢	Toggle logic between user plans
‚Ä¢	Cloud Function triggers (e.g., onSaveLook, fetchNewLook)
‚Ä¢	UI rendering across screens, buttons, and navigations
‚Ä¢	Cross-device and OS version testing across iOS & Android
2. Web UI & Marketing Page Validation
‚Ä¢	Responsive checks for key flows on the web version (home, onboarding, lookbook, wardrobe, profile, subscription)
‚Ä¢	Cross-browser checks (Chrome, Safari, Edge, Firefox ‚Äì latest versions)
‚Ä¢	Validation of marketing landing page (content rendering, navigation, forms, CTAs)
‚Ä¢	Alignment between app and web versions for consistency
3. Infra & Data Readiness
‚Ä¢	Firestore rules & doc-level permission testing
‚Ä¢	Firebase function triggers, header validation, fallback checks
‚Ä¢	Token/session integrity across login methods (Apple, Facebook, OTP)
‚Ä¢	Storage URL safety & environment protection
‚Ä¢	UserID linkage to looks, subscriptions, and logs
4. Security & Stability Checks
‚Ä¢	Penetration tests (token replay, API abuse, rate limits)
‚Ä¢	Endpoint/header injection probes
‚Ä¢	Razorpay sandbox masking & validation
‚Ä¢	Smoke testing before each release
‚Ä¢	Regression testing to prevent old bugs from resurfacing
5. Exploratory & Network Testing
‚Ä¢	Exploratory testing simulating real-user behavior
‚Ä¢	Performance across networks (slow Wi-Fi, 4G, 5G, fast Wi-Fi)
Deliverables & Milestones (Fixed Fee $300)
We work in structured phases to reduce risk. Fixed payouts are milestone-based (M1-M4); the variable discretionary performance bonus is separate.
M1 - Setup & Sanity (10%) - $30
‚Ä¢	Test credentials configured on builds
‚Ä¢	Initial smoke tests on key flows
‚Ä¢	Security & data sanity checks logged
M2 - Functional & Web UI Testing (20%) - $60
‚Ä¢	Full functional + UI testing across iOS & Android
‚Ä¢	Responsive checks for Web UI & marketing page
‚Ä¢	Structured bug tracker (screenshots/ videos in Trello)
M3 - Regression, Security & Cross-Device Testing (50%) - $150
‚Ä¢	Device/OS coverage across Android & iOS
‚Ä¢	Regression testing on new builds
‚Ä¢	Security & network variation checks
‚Ä¢	Closure confirmed for critical bugs
M4 - Final QA Report & Handover (20%) - $60
‚Ä¢	Final QA summary & sign-off document
‚Ä¢	Retest of patched builds
‚Ä¢	Preparation for launch
Discretionary Bonus (up to $200)
A discretionary performance bonus may be released after the beta launch, in two back-ended stages linked to early risk detection and post-launch stability.
Stage 1 ‚Äì Beta Launch Sign-off (40%)
Paid after the public beta launch once:
‚Ä¢	All high-risk defects (crash, data leak, payment failure, login/session breach) have been identified early and closed or validated as resolved.
‚Ä¢	No critical blockers appear in the first two weeks of beta usage.
‚Ä¢	If any high-risk issue surfaces post-launch that should reasonably have been caught during QA, the corresponding bonus portion may be docked proportionally.
Stage 2 ‚Äì Post-Launch Stability (60%)
Paid 30 days after beta launch, provided:
‚Ä¢	No new high-risk issues arise in previously tested flows.
‚Ä¢	Fewer than 3 medium-risk or 10 low-risk cosmetic bugs remain open.
‚Ä¢	No security regressions (MITM, token reuse, API exposure) are detected.
‚Ä¢	Tester remains available for clarification and limited retesting support.
Note:
The bonus is discretionary and contingent upon post-launch performance and early-capture prudence, not raw bug count.
Out-of-scope or new-feature issues introduced after QA hand-off are excluded.
Engagement Rules
‚Ä¢	Milestone-based contract, not open-ended hourly. Deliverables = payouts.
‚Ä¢	All bugs must include device/OS, repro steps, expected vs. actual, and screenshots/videos.
‚Ä¢	Vague comments like ‚Äúworks on some devices‚Äù won‚Äôt cut it. If it‚Äôs not reproducible, it‚Äôs not usable.
‚Ä¢	Clear scope, clear payouts. No surprises, no detours. Anything outside contract is grounds for instant termination with no payouts - we work on trust and professionalism.
‚Ä¢	All comms/deliverables through Upwork/Trello/Slack for transparency & safety.
Ideal Candidate
‚Ä¢	Proven QA experience in mobile apps (iOS + Android) and web UI/landing page testing
‚Ä¢	Hands-on with Firebase/Firestore apps
‚Ä¢	Familiar with payment flows (Razorpay or similar)
‚Ä¢	Skilled in login/session testing (Apple, Facebook, OTP)
‚Ä¢	Strong in functional, regression, exploratory, and UI testing
‚Ä¢	Able to simulate network variation & basic penetration checks
‚Ä¢	Excellent English, structured bug reporting, fast turnaround
Screening Questions
1.	Have you tested apps using Firebase, Razorpay, or Postman workflows? Share an example.
2.	How do you validate that user-specific data (preferences/payments) correctly link to userIDs across login flows?
3.	What tools/formats do you use for bug logging (Sheets, Notion, Trello, etc.)?
4.	Describe your recent multi-device/multi-version testing experience.
5.	What‚Äôs your approach to ensuring launch readiness and regression validation in short sprints?
Why Apply?
This is your chance to be the final line of defense before launch. If you‚Äôre meticulous, energetic, and excited by the idea of testing a next-gen fashion-tech app, we would love to hear from you.
Skills: Usability Testing, API Testing, Functional Testing, Regression Testing

Title: QA Tester & Product manager
Description:
We're looking for a proactive, product-minded QA Lead who can take full ownership of quality across our booking, payments, website, and provider platform. This is not a passive testing role. You will act as the quality gatekeeper, thinking like a product manager, predicting issues before they happen, and ensuring flawless launches.
What You‚Äôll take ownership for:
1) End-to-end QA for app, web, admin portal, and website.
2) Creation and execution of test plans, regression tests, and release checklists.
3) Identifying gaps, edge cases, missing states, and unclear UX flows.
4) Documenting bugs with clear reproduction steps and assigning them to developers.
5) Following through until each issue is tested, fixed, and closed.
6) Reviewing designs, flows, and early builds to catch issues before development finishes.
7) Owning the quality of booking flows, payments, provider availability, notifications, and calendar logic.
Requirements:
1) Substantial experience with software QA
2) Strong understanding of UX, flow logic, states, and user journeys.
3) Experience writing test cases and maintaining regression suites.
4) Excellent communication and detail orientation.
5) Proactive, takes ownership, and thinks like a product manager.
6) Comfortable working in a fast-moving startup environment.
Skills: Usability Testing, End-to-End Testing, Functional Testing, Quality Assurance, Performance Testing

Description: We are seeking individuals to test our mobile app on iOS platforms and provide valuable feedback for improvement. Allowed Applicant Countries: United Kingdom, United States, Canada, Australia, France

Title: Website Testing - Ohio, Michigan, Pennsylvania, West Virginia, Kentucky, and Indiana
Description:
Hello Upwork users,
Looking for an exciting opportunity to work with a dynamic marketing company?
LawMed Social is a marketing company based out of Santa Monica, CA that helps professional businesses across the country including law firms and medical practices increase their online presence through SEO (search engine optimization).
We're currently conducting research on the impact of human activity versus AI/ML (Artificial Intelligence/ Machine Learning) on various websites. As a part of our research, we are looking for individuals to participate in our beta testing program. This program will evaluate the impact that community interaction has on SEO (search engine optimization).
Compensation: This will be a one-time project and compensation will be competitive at $50.00 for approximately 1 hour of work.
Requirements:
-Have an established Google profile.
-Live in Ohio, Michigan, Pennsylvania, West Virginia, Kentucky, and Indiana
If you meet the requirements above and are interested in moving forward, please submit your proposal and someone from our team will get back to you with the next steps.

Hello Upwork users,
Looking for an exciting opportunity to work with a dynamic marketing company?
LawMed Social is a marketing company based out of Santa Monica, CA that helps professional businesses across the country including law firms and medical practices increase their online presence through SEO (search engine optimization).
We're currently conducting research on the impact of human activity versus AI/ML (Artificial Intelligence/ Machine Learning) on various websites. As a part of our research, we are looking for individuals to participate in our beta testing program. This program will evaluate the impact that community interaction has on SEO (search engine optimization).
Compensation: This will be a one-time project and compensation will be competitive at $50.00 for approximately 1 hour of work.
Requirements:
-Have an established Google profile.
-Live in Washington State, Oregon, or Idaho
If you meet the requirements above and are interested in moving forward, please submit your proposal and someone from our team will get back to you with the next steps.
Skills: Web Testing, Content Writing, Market Research

Title: US-Based Payment Tester (Visa Debit / Apple Pay) Real Rebill Test, 7-Day Cycle
Description:
Job Description:
We are looking for 1‚Äì3 experienced payment testers based in the United States who can help us reproduce and diagnose an issue with D7 rebills (7-day auto-renew charges) on Visa/Mastercard cards.
This is NOT a scam, NO card linking on third-party websites, and NO sharing of banking credentials.
You will simply make a real purchase (a $1 trial), wait 7 days, and observe how your bank processes the automatic renewal.
We ONLY require:
‚Äì a real US-issued Visa Debit or Visa/Mastercard card
‚Äì optionally: device with Apple Pay
‚Äì willingness to record screen + note banking notifications
What you will do:
You will go through a standard subscription flow like a regular customer:
Create an account (you will use your own email).
Purchase a $1 trial (via Visa or Apple Pay).
Wait for the auto-renewal on Day 7 ($45).
Record what happens during the rebill:
Was the charge approved?
If declined:
What decline code appeared? (Issuer decline / Do Not Honor / Generic decline)
Did you receive any SMS/email/push from your bank?
Did Apple Pay show ‚Äúverify transaction‚Äù?
Did nothing happen at all?
Requirements:
‚úî Must be located in the United States
‚úî Must have a US-issued Visa Debit card (top priority)
‚úî Mastercard testers are also welcome
‚úî Ability to record screen on iPhone/Android
‚úî Comfortable doing one real payment test
‚úî Card must have at least $50 balance for auto-renewal attempt
‚úî 7-day availability to observe the rebill
Nice to have:
‚Ä¢ Apple Pay enabled
‚Ä¢ Prior experience as payment tester / QA on fintech products
‚Ä¢ Ability to test from more than one card (extra paid)
Compensation:
$80‚Äì$150 per test cycle (per card)
additional bonus for testers who can test 2‚Äì3 cards
we reimburse the $1 trial fee
This is a one-time task with potential for ongoing collaboration for other GEOs.
Why this is legit:
We are a US/EU-based product company researching issuer-side decline reasons for recurring payments.
We do NOT request:
card numbers
login credentials
screenshots of sensitive card data
Only what your bank normally shows during legitimate purchases.
To Apply:
Please answer:
Your country + state
Card types you have (Visa Debit? Mastercard? Apple Pay?)
Whether you can start this week
Whether you can test multiple cards (if available)
Skills: Web Testing, Usability Testing, Penetration Testing, Software QA

Title: Bug Hunters Needed for Payment Method Testing (SF-0000371)
Description: We are seeking motivated bug hunters from Liechtenstein for a test with our client, VISA. The task is simple: just check how fast a transaction arrives in your bank account. Your primary responsibility will be to identify any bugs, glitches, or usability issues during the testing phase and report the transfer time to us. You will receive guidance on specific scenarios to test, but your keen eye for detail will be crucial in uncovering hidden problems. No bank data whatsoever will be collected from you! Testbirds is GDPR-compliant and will never share your information with other parties.
Skills: Web Testing, Bug Reports, Functional Testing, Software QA

Title: Part-Time Manual QA Tester for monday.com + Google Sheets Integration
Description:
We are seeking a detail-oriented Manual QA Tester to join our team on a part-time basis. The ideal candidate will be responsible for manually testing our integration between monday.com and Google Sheets, ensuring functionality, usability, and performance meet our standards. Your attention to detail will help us identify any issues and provide suggestions for improvements. This role requires solid experience in manual testing, familiarity with both platforms, and the ability to document findings clearly.
What you‚Äôll do
‚Ä¢	Jump into each new feature, explore, and break things (politely).
‚Ä¢	Log high-impact bugs only‚Äîclear, reproducible, developer-ready.
‚Ä¢	Smoke-test releases, verify fixes, suggest quick UX tweaks.
Must-haves
‚Ä¢	2 + yrs manual testing of modern web apps.
‚Ä¢	Sharp eye for UX, data mapping, edge cases.
‚Ä¢	Concise English reports (steps, expected, actual, screenshot/GIF, recordings).
‚Ä¢	Comfortable with browser DevTools and basic API concepts.
Nice-to-haves
‚Ä¢	monday.com or Google Sheets API experience.
‚Ä¢	Familiar with job queues / rate-limit scenarios.
‚Ä¢	Interest in AI-powered productivity tools.
How to apply
Record a short Loom (‚â§ 2 min) and cover:
1.	Your QA background ‚Äì total years and key domains you‚Äôve tested.
2.	Why you think you‚Äôre a strong fit for this role.
No video ‚Üí no review.
Looking forward to meeting a sharp eye! üöÄ
‚Äî Idan, loopFlows AI
Skills: Web Testing, Bug Tracking & Reports, Virtual Assistance, Software Testing

Title: E-commerce Website Audit (UX, QA, Performance)
Description:
We are looking for an experienced website auditor to review an e-commerce platform and provide a professional report with actionable insights.
Scope of Work
. UX & conversion audit: navigation, product search, filters, cart, and checkout flow.
. QA review: functionality, pricing/SKU consistency, payment and checkout success.
. Performance & speed: page load time, responsiveness across devices/browsers.
. Accessibility & localization review (languages, payment and delivery options).
Deliverables
. Comprehensive audit report with screenshots and evidence.
. Prioritized list of issues (Critical / High / Medium).
. Recommendations for improvements and quick wins.
Requirements
. Strong experience in UX, QA, and e-commerce best practices.
. Ability to deliver clear, structured findings.
Skills: Web Testing, Usability Testing, Mobile App Testing, Web Design

Title: QA Engineer (Accounts & Finance Domain)
Description:
Project Duration: 4‚Äì5 Months
Team Size: 5 (QA Engineer [Your Role], Backend Developer, Frontend Developer, UX Designer, Project Manager)
About the Project:
We are building a robust Accounts & Finance Software Application using Java Spring Boot and MS-SQL. The database schema is already prepared, and development is underway. We are seeking an Expert QA Engineer who can work under pressure, ensure quality delivery, and bring in strong domain knowledge in Accounts & Finance systems.
Your Role:
As the QA Engineer, you will be responsible for:
- Designing and executing test cases for finance/accounting workflows.
- Performing functional, regression, integration, and security testing.
- Validating complex financial modules such as General Ledger, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Budgeting, Closing Process, and MIS Reports.
- Ensuring accuracy, scalability, and security compliance of financial reports and transactions.
- Collaborating with developers and UX to identify, track, and resolve issues quickly.
- Managing end-to-end testing under tight deadlines.
Must-Have Requirements:
- Accounts & Finance domain knowledge is mandatory (ERP, accounting, or financial systems QA experience).
- Proven experience as a QA Engineer in enterprise-level financial applications.
- Strong skills in test planning, execution, and reporting.
- Familiarity with MS-SQL (for query validation and data testing).
- Experience with manual testing (automation knowledge is a plus).
- Ability to work independently under pressure with high attention to detail.
Nice-to-Have:
- Exposure to Java Spring Boot backend testing.
- Experience in testing MIS and custom reporting modules.
- Knowledge of security and compliance testing for financial systems.
What We Offer:
- Competitive freelance compensation.
- Flexible working hours (remote).
Opportunity to work on a mission-critical Accounts & Finance system with a skilled cross-functional team.
How to Apply:
If you have the QA expertise with Accounts & Finance domain knowledge, and can handle the pressure of a Jan 2025 deadline, please send us:
- Your portfolio of relevant finance/accounting projects tested
- Your availability for the next 4‚Äì5 months
Thanks
Skills: Web Testing, API Testing, Mobile App Testing, Bug Tracking & Reports

Title: QA Engineers Needed ‚Äì T&M Basis (Automation, Functional, Regression, E-commerce)
Description:
We are a North American e-commerce company in the flowers & gifts sector seeking experienced QA partners to support our ongoing digital transformation. This engagement is on a flexible, hourly (T&M) basis.
Our technology stack includes:
Back-end: PHP 7, Nginx, Linux
Microservices: Laravel Lumen, React, Vue.js
E-commerce: Shopify storefronts & custom middleware APIs
CMS: Legacy PHP 7 monolithic CMS
Responsibilities:
Functional, regression, and integration testing
Test automation framework setup and script development (Playwright, Cypress, Selenium preferred)
Performance & load testing (JMeter, K6, Postman)
Security testing (penetration testing, vulnerability scans)
Deliverables: test plans, test cases, automation framework & documentation (to be reused by internal repeated testing)
Knowledge transfer sessions with our internal QA team
Engagement Model:
Hourly billing (T&M) ‚Äì no fixed minimum or maximum hours
Must provide flexible scaling up/down depending on workload (e.g., seasonal peaks)
Minimum 2‚Äì3 hours overlap with EST time zone required
Engagement starts with a 1-month pilot, extendable into long-term contract
Ideal Partner:
Proactive communication and defect reporting
Strong e-commerce QA experience (Shopify preferred)
Ability to scale resources seamlessly
Strategic input on QA maturity and automation best practices
Please include in your proposal:
Hourly rates
Relevant QA experience with Shopify, PHP, Laravel, React/Vue.js
Examples of similar e-commerce QA projects(if any)
Preferred automation and performance tools
Skills: Web Testing, Software QA, Test Case Design, Test Automation

Title: QA & QC Specialist for Website Testing
Description:
We are seeking a specialized detail orientated QA/QC professional or agency to thoroughly test and ensure our website is fully responsive, functional, secure, and performance-optimized across all major devices and browsers.
Your role will be to perform comprehensive quality assurance testing using both manual and automated tools, following a testing script based on our Adobe XD mockups, and deliver detailed reports with screenshots (side by side image of development vs prototype "Adobe XD"), highlighting issues, comparisons, and recommendations.
We specifically wish the QC team to test:
1. Responsiveness Testing
- Verify layout and UI consistency across all devices (desktop, tablet, mobile).
- Test on all major browsers (Chrome, Safari, Firefox, Edge).
- Perform both manual and software-assisted testing to detect alignment, spacing, and scaling issues.
2. Functional Testing
- Validate navigation flow, buttons, links, forms, modals, and user interactions.
- Ensure all features work as intended per Adobe XD design references.
3. Security Testing
- Check SSL implementation and certificate validity.
- Identify potential vulnerabilities in form submissions or exposed endpoints.
4. Performance & Optimization Testing
- Assess page load speed, caching efficiency, and image optimization.
- Review code structure for unnecessary scripts, poor optimization, or slow elements (this is VERY IMPORTANT).
Would seek a test QC before starting, base on ability identify tickets on:
- security, performance (code structure), functionality & responsive & manner of feedback explanation url, side by side image (development vs prototype) & video

https://staging.edmarkind.com

Title: Quality Assurance Tester Needed for Web Application
Description:
Job Title: QA Tester
About Us:
We are dedicated to revolutionising the food ordering industry by integrating nutritional analysis into the customer experience. Our unique app not only simplifies food ordering but also emphasises health by recommending dishes based on their nutritional content. The platform features a comprehensive restaurant interface for recipe analysis and a user-friendly ordering system, similar to leading online food services.
Role Overview:
We are seeking a meticulous and detail-oriented QA Tester to join our team. You will play a critical role in ensuring the quality, functionality, and usability of our web and mobile applications. You will work closely with developers and product managers to identify, document, and track issues, ensuring our users have a seamless and reliable experience.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop and execute test plans, test cases, and test scripts for web and mobile applications.
Identify, document, and track bugs, inconsistencies, and performance issues.
Collaborate with developers and product managers to understand features and requirements.
Perform regression, functional, integration, and user acceptance testing.
Ensure adherence to quality standards and best practices throughout the development lifecycle.
Provide constructive feedback to improve usability, performance, and overall user experience.
Technology Stack:
Front-end: Next.js
Containerization: Docker
Database: PostgreSQL
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and cloud environments is a plus.
Key Skills & Qualifications:
Proven experience in QA testing for web or mobile applications.
Strong knowledge of manual and automated testing methodologies.
Proficiency in Next.js, Docker, and PostgreSQL.
Experience with testing tools such as Selenium, Cypress, JIRA, TestRail, or similar.
Understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC) and Agile methodologies.
Excellent attention to detail, analytical thinking, and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication skills to clearly report bugs and collaborate with the team.
Familiarity with API testing (Postman or similar) is a plus.
Preferred:
Experience in health, nutrition, or food-related applications.
Knowledge of automated testing frameworks and scripting languages (Python, JavaScript).
Familiarity with cloud environments (AWS, GCP, or Azure).
Skills: Web Testing, Software QA, Functional Testing, Usability Testing, Bug Reports

Title: Web App Stress Testing Engineer (2-Week Contract)
Description:
### **Description:**
We are looking for an experienced QA or performance testing engineer to conduct stress testing on a web application built using Lovable. The app relies on internal API calls, database reads/writes, and integrations with external APIs.
The goal is to simulate real-world traffic, identify performance bottlenecks, and ensure the system remains stable and responsive under load. Responsibilities:
- Design and execute **load, stress, and concurrency tests** simulating realistic user activity.
- Measure backend performance including uptime, latency, and throughput under varying loads.
- Identify bottlenecks in APIs, database queries, and frontend rendering.
- Recommend specific performance improvements and scalability strategies.
- Produce a final report summarizing test setup, data, and key findings.
Requirements:
- Demonstrated experience in load and performance testing for **web applications**.
- Proficiency with tools such as k6, JMeter, Locust, or Artillery.
- Familiarity with Next.js, Node.js, and Supbase / similar stacks.
- Ability to design and simulate concurrent user sessions at different scales.
- Strong communication and technical documentation skills.
---
Preferred Qualifications:
- Experience testing apps built on Lovable or similar low-code/full-stack platforms.
Timeline:
Two-week contract, starting immediately.
Skills: Web Testing, Software QA, Functional Testing, Penetration Testing

Title: Product QA Tester
Description:
Time commitment: 10 hours per week to start
Location: Remote
Hourly range: $3/hour, depending on experience and fit + additional $1 per valid bug found (criteria to be shared once onboarded).
Company Description
Wonsulting was founded in 2019 with the mission of turning underdogs into winners. We help individuals from non-target schools and non-traditional backgrounds secure their dream careers. To date, we‚Äôve helped thousands of job seekers land offers at top companies including Google, Meta, Deloitte, Goldman Sachs, and more. Our focus is on empowering talent and providing resources that drive real career success.
Role Description
We are looking for a Product QA Tester (Part-Time, Remote) to help ensure our AI-powered tools meet the highest standards of quality, reliability, and usability. This role is centered on testing, validation, and user experience, not just bug detection. You‚Äôll work closely with our product, design, and engineering teams to rigorously test features, identify edge cases, and ensure that every release is stable and impactful for users.
Your focus areas will be:
1) Manual Testing ‚Äì Execute test plans for new features across web apps, conversational AI flows, and user interfaces.
2) Edge Case Validation ‚Äì Proactively identify input scenarios and unusual use cases that may break workflows or degrade AI output quality.
3) Regression Testing ‚Äì Validate fixes and ensure existing features remain stable when new updates are deployed.
4) Bug Reporting & Tracking ‚Äì Clearly document defects, reproduce issues, and work with engineering to ensure timely resolution.
Qualifications
- Proven experience in software QA testing (2+ years preferred, B2C SaaS or AI products a plus).
- Familiarity with both manual testing methodologies (automated testing a plus)
- Strong attention to detail; ability to catch inconsistencies in formatting, tone, and UX.
- Comfort documenting and tracking issues using tools like Jira, Asana, or similar.
- Strong problem-solving, critical thinking, and communication skills.
- Ability to work independently in a fractional/part-time capacity.
Time commitment: 10 hours per week to start
Location: Remote Hourly range: $3/hour, depending on experience and fit + additional $1 per valid bug found (criteria to be shared once onboarded).
Note: Please view full job description attached to be considered.
Skills: Web Testing, Bug Tracking & Reports, Regression Testing, Manual Testing

Three-Product Testing: You will work across three components: the recording Chrome extension, our web-based portal, and the SDK wrapper extension used for replay testing. You‚Äôll ensure that recorded workflows appear correctly in the portal and that the playback extension can inject the SDK and replay all scenarios without issues.
Detailed Scenario Coverage: You‚Äôll handle all potential scenarios, including interruptions during a workflow. For example, if a user stops mid-onboarding, you‚Äôll verify that they can resume smoothly and that the AI guidance and real-time voice sessions remain stable.
Stage-Gate for Releases: You will serve as the final quality checkpoint before new releases go live. After our engineers finish staging a version, you‚Äôll quickly and thoroughly test it and then give the green light for deployment. This means you need to be both detail-oriented and fast, as we rely on you to avoid bottlenecks.
Requirements:
Proven experience in manual QA testing, especially with browser extensions or web applications.
Ability to test and validate multiple related products (recording extension, web portal, SDK extension).
High attention to detail and a proactive approach to identifying and solving issues.
Fast turnaround times: we need someone who can test and provide feedback within a few hours when needed.
While automated testing experience is a plus, it‚Äôs not required. If you excel in this role, there‚Äôs potential for ongoing collaboration. We‚Äôre looking forward to working with a dedicated QA partner who can help us deliver a flawless product experience.

Company Description
Wonsulting was founded in 2019 with the mission of turning underdogs into winners. We help individuals from non-target schools and non-traditional backgrounds secure their dream careers. To date, we‚Äôve helped thousands of job seekers land offers at top companies including Google, Meta, Deloitte, Goldman Sachs, and more. You‚Äôll work closely with our product, design, and engineering teams to rigorously test features, identify edge cases, and ensure that every release is stable and impactful for users.

1) Manual Testing ‚Äì Execute test plans for new features across web apps, conversational AI flows, and user interfaces.
2) Edge Case Validation ‚Äì Proactively identify input scenarios and unusual use cases that may break workflows or degrade AI output quality.
3) Regression Testing ‚Äì Validate fixes and ensure existing features remain stable when new updates are deployed.
4) Bug Reporting & Tracking ‚Äì Clearly document defects, reproduce issues, and work with engineering to ensure timely resolution.
Qualifications
- Proven experience in software QA testing (2+ years preferred, B2C SaaS or AI products a plus).
- Familiarity with both manual testing methodologies (automated testing a plus)
- Strong attention to detail; ability to catch inconsistencies in formatting, tone, and UX.
- Comfort documenting and tracking issues using tools like Jira, Asana, or similar.
- Strong problem-solving, critical thinking, and communication skills.
- Ability to work independently in a fractional/part-time capacity.
Time commitment: 10 hours per week to start
Location: Remote Hourly range: $3/hour, depending on experience and fit + additional $1 per valid bug found (criteria to be shared once onboarded).

Title: WordPress & AI Automation Specialist for Bilingual Blog & Social Media Syndication (Hostinger VPS)
Description:
### **Job Title:**
**WordPress & AI Automation Specialist for Bilingual Blog & Social Media Syndication (Hostinger VPS)**
### **Job Description:**
**Project Overview:**
I am seeking a highly skilled and reliable automation specialist to build a comprehensive, user-friendly content workflow. This project involves automating the creation, publishing, and social media syndication of blog posts and press releases on my existing WordPress website.
I require an expert who can deliver a robust, well-documented, and easy-to-manage solution. I currently have a **WordPress website hosted on a Hostinger VPS**, and I would prefer to leverage this infrastructure for the automation.
**Key Requirements & Deliverables:**
The successful freelancer will be responsible for creating a seamless, end-to-end automation workflow with the following capabilities:
1. **AI-Powered Content Generation:**
* The workflow must be triggered by a user-friendly interface that I can easily access and control.
* It will take my pre-defined AI prompts and use them to generate full-length blog posts and press releases.
2. **Bilingual Content Creation (French & English):**
* The workflow must be able to produce both a **French and an English** version of each post.
* The final output should be two separate posts in WordPress, one for each language. This needs to be correctly handled by a multilingual plugin to ensure proper language tagging and SEO.
3. **Advanced Image Management (Unsplash):**
* The automation must connect to the **Unsplash API** to select a relevant, copyright-free image for each post.
* The workflow must automatically set the image's `alt text` to contain the **Yoast SEO Focus Keyphrase** that is associated with the post.
4. **Automatic WordPress Publishing:**
* The workflow will create a new post in my WordPress dashboard with all content (title, body text, image).
* It must automatically assign the correct **categories and tags** based on information provided by the AI response. I will provide a list of available categories and tags.
* **The workflow must publish the posts directly, without saving them as drafts.**
* **The workflow must follow a specific, pre-defined content calendar. Blog posts should be posted once a week, and press releases once every other week.**
5. **Multi-Platform Social Media Syndication:**
* Upon final publication of the WordPress post, the workflow will automatically syndicate a tailored version of the content to the following accounts:
* 2 x LinkedIn Accounts
* 2 x Facebook Accounts
* 2 x X Accounts
* 1 x Instagram Account
* The social media posts should include a short, engaging summary and the featured image from the blog post.
**Technical Details & Preferred Approach:**
* **Hosting:** Hostinger VPS
* **Website:** WordPress
* **SEO Plugin:** Yoast SEO
* **Image Database:** Unsplash API
* **AI Model:** The AI model used can be any **except Google Gemini**.
* **Workflow Tool:** I would prefer to use a self-hosted solution like **n8n** on the Hostinger VPS, as this is a powerful and cost-effective option that fully utilizes my existing infrastructure. I am open to alternative suggestions, but they must be justified as a superior solution for this project.
* **APIs:** The freelancer will need to integrate with an AI text generation API, the Unsplash API, and social media APIs for LinkedIn, Facebook, X, and Instagram.
**Desired Qualities in a Freelancer:**
* Proven experience with WordPress development and API integration.
* Strong portfolio showing similar marketing automation projects.
* Specific experience with Hostinger VPS and self-hosted automation tools (`n8n` or similar) is a significant advantage.
* Understands the importance of clean, reliable code and SEO best practices (Yoast, categories, tags, alt text).
* Excellent communication skills and a willingness to provide clear documentation and a brief training session.
* Familiarity with the specific requirements and limitations of social media APIs, particularly for Instagram publishing.
**Application Instructions:**
Of course. Including the price range directly in the description is a great way to be fully transparent and ensure you attract freelancers who are aligned with your budget.
Here is the final, complete, and updated job description with the price range included.

What you‚Äôll do

Configure environment variables (QuickBooks & Genesys credentials provided separately).
Debug any remaining issues so the app:
Aggregates minutes per client correctly.
Generates proper QuickBooks invoice payloads with idempotency.
Schedules the billing job monthly.
Demonstrate a successful run with our test data (Loom video or similar).
Document the setup and hand-off so our internal team can run it monthly.
Requirements
Strong skills in Node.js/TypeScript, Docker, PostgreSQL.
Experience integrating third-party APIs (QuickBooks, Stripe, Twilio, Genesys, etc.).
Ability to read, debug, and finish an existing codebase quickly.
Excellent communication and immediate availability.
Trial & Timeline

Clone & run the repo locally or in Docker.
Configure .env from our template.
Run the billing job with provided test data and show the correct output.
Loom video demonstrating clean clone ‚Üí run ‚Üí invoices produced.
If you complete the trial successfully, we‚Äôll extend you to finish any remaining integration work immediately.
Nice to Have
Prior experience with QuickBooks Online API or usage-based billing systems.
How to Apply
Send:
A short note on your availability (can you start within 24h and dedicate time over the next 2‚Äì3 days?).
Links or Loom demos of similar API integrations you‚Äôve done (QuickBooks, Stripe, Twilio, etc.).
A GitHub repo or code sample showing your Node.js + Docker work.

Title: Automation Developer ‚Äì IG ‚Üí X (Threads with Images + Confirmation Step)
Description:
We are looking for a highly skilled automation developer to help us design, build, and deploy a system that automatically turns Instagram scripts into engaging X (Twitter) threads with visuals, while still giving us a final confirmation step before publishing.
The automation should take care of every step from pulling raw content, rewriting it into optimized thread-style posts, adding visuals, and then posting them ‚Äî all while allowing us to approve or edit drafts quickly.
This project will require a mix of API integration, workflow automation, natural language processing, and social media posting tools. If you have prior experience creating content workflows powered by LLMs (OpenAI, Claude, etc.), generating images via DALL¬∑E, Stable Diffusion, or Midjourney wrappers, and posting programmatically to X using its developer tools, this project is a perfect fit.
Our goal is to create a repeatable, polished content pipeline that saves hours each week and ensures every piece of content looks professional and aligned with our brand‚Äôs style.
The Flow We Want (Step by Step)
To give clarity, here is the exact flow we need automated:
Pull Scripts from Google Sheets
We maintain a master content calendar in Google Sheets. Each row includes a short script (a few paragraphs) originally designed for Instagram carousel posts.
The automation should be able to pull scripts from this sheet based on a daily or weekly trigger (configurable).
Rewrite Script into X Thread Format
Each script should be passed into an LLM (Claude or OpenAI GPT).
The LLM‚Äôs job: Rewrite the single Instagram script into a 6‚Äì10 post X thread.
Threads should be formatted in Marketing_Nerd style: clear, concise, punchy, psychology-driven, and engaging.
Example: If the original IG script is 300 words long, it should be broken into bite-sized posts that flow logically as a thread.
Visual Generation for Each Tweet
For each tweet in the thread, we want to attach a relevant visual. Options:
AI-generated images via DALL¬∑E, Stability AI, or Midjourney (using a bot wrapper API).
Or a curated image pulled from a stock image API (e.g., Unsplash, Pexels API).
Ideally, visuals should be aligned with the content‚Äôs tone (marketing/psychology/business themes).
Example: If the thread is about ‚Äúanchoring bias in retail pricing,‚Äù we might want a price tag visual, shopping cart illustration, or psychology sketch.
Draft Thread Compilation
The rewritten thread (text + images) should be compiled into a preview draft.
This draft should be sent to us for review before posting.
Confirmation Step
Before any post goes live, the draft thread should be sent to us via a confirmation channel. Options include:
Slack (via webhook or bot).
Telegram bot.
Or even email, if that‚Äôs easier.
We want the ability to approve, edit, or reject the draft thread before it gets scheduled.
Posting to X
Once approved, the automation should automatically post the full thread on our X account.
Posting should ideally use the X API, but if polish is easier through third-party tools (Typefully, Hypefury, etc.), we are open to that.
Technical Requirements
To make sure we attract the right developer, here‚Äôs a breakdown of the technical elements required:
Google Sheets API Integration
Read scripts from specific sheets/columns.
Trigger pulling content on a daily/weekly schedule.
Mark rows as ‚Äúprocessed‚Äù once completed.
LLM API Integration
Use Claude (Anthropic) or OpenAI GPT.
Prompt engineering to ensure threads are rewritten in the desired style.
Ability to handle text limits (each tweet must fit within 280 characters, including spaces).
Image Generation or Retrieval
API integration with at least one of the following:
DALL¬∑E (OpenAI Images API).
Stability AI.
Midjourney wrapper (Discord bot automation via API).
Or curated stock photo APIs.
Logic for aligning visuals with thread text.
Confirmation Step Integration
Slack or Telegram bot.
Send preview (thread text + visuals).
Approve/reject workflow (button or simple text command).
X API or Posting Service Integration
Direct posting to X (thread with images).
Or use a polished tool like Typefully or Hypefury with API access.
Must support scheduled posts (in case we approve but want future publishing).
Error Handling
If the LLM fails, retry automatically.
If image generation fails, use fallback stock visuals.
Log/report errors (Slack/Telegram/email).

Title: N8N Workflow Opt: Email Automation (OpenAI + API Integration)
Description:
I have a functional n8n workflow (I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs about 80% done) that automates candidate email responses for recruitment using OpenAI GPT-4, Google Docs FAQs, and Gmail/Slack integrations.
Current Workflow:
- Email Trigger (IMAP) captures incoming candidate emails
- HTTP Request reads position-specific FAQs from Google Docs
- HTTP Request reads response examples from Google Docs (for tone/style reference)
- OpenAI analyzes emails and generates responses based on strict rules
- Conditional logic (IF nodes) routes responses to Gmail or Slack
- 4 possible outcomes.
What's Working:
‚úÖ Basic structure and flow complete
‚úÖ Successfully identifies positions from subject lines
‚úÖ Answers simple FAQ questions correctly
‚úÖ Integrates with Gmail, Slack, and OpenAI
‚úÖ Reads FAQs and style examples dynamically from Google Docs
What Needs Refinement:
- Improve prompt engineering to eliminate false positives/negatives
- Handle edge cases (multiple questions, broad requests, ambiguous emails)
- Add validation layer to prevent incorrect automated responses
- Test with 20-30 real candidate email scenarios
- Optimize for 95%+ accuracy and reliability
- Add failsafes and error handling
The goal is to make this production-ready so I can confidently run it 24/7 without fear of sending incorrect responses to real candidates.

Description:
We're seeking a highly skilled N8N Workflow & Automation Specialist to join us as a growing company that builds automation solutions for multiple clients in the medical technology industry. The ideal candidate is experienced in N8N, GoHighLevel (GHL), Instantly.ai, social media platforms, and lead scraping from sources like Apollo & Clay, with a strong understanding of workflow automation, CRM connectivity, and business process optimization. You'll be responsible for building, maintaining, and optimizing no-code automations that connect various platforms (CRM, social media, chatbots, etc.) to streamline marketing and operational tasks.
Key Responsibilities:
-Design and build automated workflows using N8N and related no-code tools
-Integrate third-party applications such as GoHighLevel, Salesforce, LinkedIn, Instantly, Canva, Airtable, and Hermes AI
-Automate lead management, appointment scheduling, automatic social media posts, and follow-up communications
-Maintain and troubleshoot active automations to ensure consistent performance
-Recommend new tools, integrations, and optimizations for both internal systems and client setups
-Collaborate with the founder to analyze business processes and identify automation opportunities
-Assist in light social media automation and chatbot setup
Mandatory Requirements:
-Proven experience with N8N or similar workflow automation tools (Make, Zapier, etc.) ‚Äì MUST
-Strong understanding of CRM platforms (especially GoHighLevel)
-Familiarity with AI-based tools (e.g., chatbots, auto-responders, Instantly, Hermes, CloseBot, SynthFlow)
-Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
-Reliable communication and clear English proficiency ‚Äì MUST
-Ability to work independently with minimal supervision
-Strong knowledge of common AI tool offerings used in businesses to help owner expand client offerings
Preferred Skills:
-Familiarity with and experience working with GHL Automations ‚Äì Big Plus
-Knowledge of JavaScript or API-based integrations
-Experience with social media automation and scheduling tools
-Background in AI workflow setup for customer service, marketing, or sales
-Experience working with clients in MedTech, SaaS, or marketing industries
-AI Content & Social Media Automation knowledge (Descript, OpusClip, or VEED to cut long videos into shorts)
Why Join Us?
-Work with cutting-edge AI and automation technologies
-Join a growing company
-Collaborate directly with the founder and influence business direction
-Build expertise in multiple platforms and expand your automation skill set
-Make a tangible impact by optimizing business operations for multiple clients
If you're passionate about automation, AI integration, and helping businesses scale through smart workflows, apply now and help us transform how our clients operate!

Title: QA/ App Testing Assignment
Description:
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a detail-oriented QA tester to test and audit our mobile app on both iOS and Android devices. The goal is to identify bugs, usability issues, and performance glitches before our public launch.
- You‚Äôll need to record your screen with voice commentary during the test and - share a concise list of all bugs, issues, and UX suggestions.
Scope of Work:
- Conduct a 1-hour testing session (split across iOS and Android if possible).
- Explore all key app flows: onboarding, signup/login, browsing, checkout, wallet, etc.
- Record a 15-minute testing video with screen recording and voice narration explaining your observations in real time.
- Submit a bug/issue report in list format (Excel, Google Sheet, or PDF).
Deliverables:
üìπ 15-minute testing video with voice commentary.
üßæ Written bug & issue list (including screenshots where possible).
Requirements:
Access to both Android and iOS devices (preferred).
Experience in mobile app testing or QA.
Clear communication and attention to detail.
Bonus (Nice to Have):
Prior testing experience for fashion, e-commerce, or social apps.
Ability to suggest minor UI/UX improvements.
Budget:
üí∞ Fixed price (please propose your rate for 1 hour of testing).
To Apply:
Please include:
The devices (model + OS version) you‚Äôll use for testing.
Any prior experience testing apps (links or samples welcome).
Estimated delivery time after assignment.

Title: Looking for AI automation expert that work on applications like N&N
Description:

-Provide fast responses and support when issues arise
-Work collaboratively while I focus on sales, planning, and team management
-able to build full automation for a SEO/Web agency ( such as automation to create article and post, possibly creating backlinks is a plus point, auto replying to customer + AI agent call, data scraping + ai call agent/what message)

Title: AI Automation Specialist Guidance
Description:
Looking for a mentor to teach AI automation
I‚Äôve been working with AI automation part-time for the last 5 months, but I don‚Äôt have a proper technique for developing bots and selling them. I know the basics ‚Äî I‚Äôve worked with n8n, Zapier, Make.com, Botpress, same.new, Replit, etc.
The problem is, when I get a client who wants AI automation, I don‚Äôt know where to start. I just outsource, which creates a bad loop. I need to learn how to properly build and ship agents ‚Äî what programs to use, how to plan, and finally how to sell them.
Looking for someone who can teach me the full process and help me level up.
